results.description:
Happy New Month Everyone! My people, it's supposed to rain this week so let's meet next week on Saturday, May 21st in Central Park. Come hangout picnic style. Bring an item if you can; Snacks, Food, Water, Mat, drinks and MUSIC (highly recommended). If we have a DJ in the house LOL, please email me if not we can use our cell phones.

Just anything you can lay your hands on :) It should be casual and fun. The games include playing dodge ball, bike riding, running or  take long walks around the park and return to our station just for the fun of it. Come with cards or even chess if you like. Also add dance competition to the list of activities :)

I am going to keep updating the event, we want it to be very fun and interactive. Again, please free to share ideas.

results.description:
General rules of the game:

No called balls/strikes.  You get three swings to put the ball into play.

No taking leads.

Sliding is allowed but be careful.  Be mindful of who is covering the base if you choose to slide.

Game is capped at 24 to ensure those that sign up will get a lot of playing time and at-bats.

Unless someone wants to play C the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

Unless someone wants to pitch the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

If 24 people sign up, the defense will be rotated so that each team member plays 4 innings in the field for each 1 they sit.

Fee structure:

First game free.

$5 per person per game

$25 for the season.

Please arrive promptly by 4pm.

I'll email/post in the event of inclement weather potentially impacting the game.  Alternatively you can call the hotline at[masked] x111

results.description:
About twice a year I like to throw in a piece of classic literature. Something that was written pre-literary award era, whose only award is the mere fact it has entered the canon of literature. Mary Ann Evans, known by her pen name George Eliot, was an English novelist, journalist, translator and one of the leading writers of the Victorian era. Most of her novels are set in provincial England and known for their realism and psychological insight.

Evans used a male pen name, she said, to ensure her works would be taken seriously. Female authors were published under their own names during Eliot's life, but she wanted to escape the stereotype of women only writing lighthearted romances. She also wished to have her fiction judged separately from her already extensive and widely known work as an editor and critic. 

Middlemarch, was first published in eight installments during 1871–2. The novel is set in the fictitious Midlands town of Middlemarch during 1829–32,and it comprises several distinct (though intersecting) stories and a large cast of characters. Significant themes include the status of women, the nature of marriage, idealism, self-interest, religion, hypocrisy, political reform, and education. Although the first reviews were mixed, it is now widely regarded as her best work and one of the greatest novels written in English.

The poet Emily Dickinson expressed high praise for the novel, and it was admired by Friedrich Nietzsche for its exposure of the fear of social realities that lie beneath any conception of society. Virginia Woolf called it "One of the few English novels written for grown-up people."

This is not a light read--it weighs in at 800 pages! I'm giving plenty of notice for anyone interested in discussing this book because we shall all need more than a week or two to digest this one!
results.name: George Eliot's Middlemarch, A Study of Provincial Life

This film is part of the Panorama Europe 2016 series at the museum:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lnq8O1-fVeo

Presented by the Instituto Cervantes

Spain. Dir. Alberto Rodríguez. 2014, 105 mins.
In Spanish with English subtitles.
With Javier Gutiérrez, Raúl Arévalo. 

A moody, noir-tinged mystery unfolds amidst the political unrest of post-Franco Spain in this riveting Spanish thriller. Based on a true story, the film follows two mismatched detectives from Madrid dispatched to the forbidding marshlands of Southern Spain to investigate the disappearance of two teenage sisters. However, it soon becomes clear that they are dealing not with a missing persons case, but with a serial killer. Awash in an atmosphere of pervasive dread,Marshland is “a brilliant, compelling edge-of-your-seat detective thriller infused with a spirit of uncanny gothic redolent of David Lynch and David Fincher” (Sight & Sound).

Tickets: $12 (Free for members at the Film Lover and MoMI Kids Premium levels and above). Order tickets online. (Members may contact [masked] with any questions regarding online reservations.)  

Since events of this kind typically sell out, I strongly recommend that you order your tickets early

Please be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates regarding this event.

Lift Your Hearts, Lift Your Spirits! The jazz musician knows what musical notes mean on a page . . . but is free to ignore them and where the heart leads. At Jazz Vespers, the leading of the heart is most purely attributed to the Spirit’s leading.

Join folks of a like heart and spirit for a time of JOYFUL JAZZ VESPERS! We’ll meet up this Saturday, May 21, from 5:00 to 6:15 just as the day begins to settle into evening.

We’ll be in the presence of some of NYC’s choice jazz musicians, Charlie Caranacus on trumpet, Jerry Dodgion on saxophone, Art Baron on trombone, Karl Kaminski on bass, and Jeff Hershfield on drums. Clayton Bryant will be the featured soloist and Maurice Chestnut, protégé of Savion Glover, will be tap dancer par excellence. Noted jazz artist, Anne Phillips, will be on piano and serve as Director.

This incredible line-up is sponsored by Resurrection Church NYC meeting at the Church of the Good Shepherd at 240 East 31st Street. There’s no cost or obligation, just a ready heart for an uplift in spirit! 

Now get acquainted with Maurice Chestnut HERE and plan to meet him this Saturday at Jazz Vespers!

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George, Priyo, & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

(photo of atrium and location of meetup table)

(photo of atrium entrance at the corner of 53rd and Lex.)


At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
Hola amigos,

Join us for an afternoon of good cinema, fun and camaradie. We'll watch Truman, the new film by Catalan director Cesc Gay with Ricardo Darín and Javier Cámara. Truman is a sensitively-written and beautifully film played by two great actors that tackles complex issues in a refreshingly straightforward, downbeat way. Cesc Gay's wise, wistful and well-observed film about two friends is by turns amusing and affecting - and quite often both at once.

In Spanish, with good English subtitles - Event is Good for ALL levels

https://youtu.be/XhMG-3KR1L8

EVENT SCHEDULE

- Saturday, May 21, 2016

5:00 pm: Door opens. Meet others and practice your Spanish!
5:20 pm: A brief intro to the movie - Movie starts
7:10 pm: Movie ends - Short commentary - Stay and meet others!
7:30 pm: Event officially ends 

COST $6 in advance. $10 at the door (if space is available)

Please remember that simply click as "YES" does NOT reserve a spot, only advance payment does. This goes for all our events

SYNOPSIS


Childhood friends Julián (Ricardo Darín) and Tomás (Javier Cámara) were once inseparable. Eventually, the two have lost sight of their friendship. While the divorced Julián remained in Spain where he has lived through the highs and lows of an acting career, the teacher Tomás emigrated to Canada, where he has built up a peaceful existence together with his job, his wife and his children. After a reunion one day in Madrid, their friendship survived once again, as if it had never fallen asleep. 


TECHNICAL INFORMATION

Director: Cesc Gay

Writers: Tomàs Aragay, Cesc Gay

Stars: Ricardo Darín, Javier Cámara, Dolores Fonzi 

Spain, 2015

All our movie events are with our own projector, large screen & sound system. 

¡Allá nos vemos!


Jorge

results.description:
Welcome!

Join us for our half-court co-ed game of basketball.  12 spots will be available for this half-court event.  The format of the games will be similar to our standard run, but we the co-ed aspect will only over half the court.  The other half of the court will be reserved for a women's only game.  Women, if you prefer to play with women only, please RSVP on the "Women's Only" meetup event on this same date.

Other than that, the idea will be basically the same:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds.  

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. 

Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.


*****NEW*****

Share your Spotify playlists and tracks with us and we'll play them during gametime!

Send an email to [masked]

And please submit good tunes otherwise we'll be Basketball for the Musically Challenged...
results.name: Co-Ed Half-Court Game

results.description:
The samba for beginners’ class starts with a 30-minute warm up that exercises basic isolation of the body, following by stretching and strengthening exercises. After the warm up, Danielle introduces the students samba no pé (basic samba step) and passo marcado (simple choreographies) typical of the Rio Carnival. The whole class happens in the sound of the upbeat and irresistible Brazilian music.

The class will be held on Saturday from 5-6:30pm and costs $18.

Come with comfortable clothes and be prepared to be barefoot.

About the instructor:

Danielle Lima was born in Rio de Janeiro and grew up performing with Beija-Flor de Nilópolis, one of Brazil’s most famous samba schools. Danielle Lima is also a Certified Teachers Artist of the program Dancing Classrooms from American Ballroom Theater, Certified YOGA Instructor at YOGA Effects in NYC and Karma Kids Yoga certified teacher.

For more information, contact Danielle Lima daniellelima13@ hotmail.com.

A unique opportunity for you to experience stillness in the city that is always ON. Leveraging the ancient techniques of yoga, breath and meditation, the 60 minute session will allow you to go beyond daily mental stresses and help you recharge yourself and tap into greater happiness, purpose, creativity & intuition.

This 60-minute free meditation class is open for people with any or no experience with meditation, yoga or breathing. It is an introduction to the Art of Living's Get Happy Program:

http://us.programs.artofliving.org/n/get-happy/

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living's Get-Happy Program.  We will explore breath and meditation, as well as other tools which are taught on the Get-Happy Program. 

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

Suggested topic (Plese view TEDx video before meetup)

"Biological Anthropologist Helen Fisher studies the brain in love and shares with us her newest research about why we love who we love."  TEDxEast  (i.e. Helen Fisher's research on personality type, brain chemistry, and attraction.)  

About Helen Fisher

"Anthropologist Helen Fisher studies gender differences and the evolution of human emotions. She's best known as an expert on romantic love, and her beautifully penned books — including Anatomy of Love and Why We Love — lay bare the mysteries of our most treasured emotion.Why you should listen

Helen Fisher's courageous investigations of romantic love -- its evolution, its biochemical foundations and its vital importance to human society -- are informing and transforming the way we understand ourselves. Fisher describes love as a universal human drive (stronger than the sex drive; stronger than thirst or hunger; stronger perhaps than the will to live), and her many areas of inquiry shed light on timeless human mysteries, like why we choose one partner over another.

Almost unique among scientists, Fisher explores the science of love without losing a sense of romance: Her work frequently invokes poetry, literature and art -- along with scientific findings -- helping us appreciate our love affair with love itself. In her research, and in books such as Anatomy of Love, Why We Love, and her latest work Why Him? Why Her?: How to Find and Keep Lasting Love, Fisher looks at questions with real impact on modern life. Her latest research raises serious concerns about the widespread, long-term use of antidepressants, which may undermine our natural process of attachment by tampering with hormone levels in the brain.

What others say

“In hands as skilled and sensitive as Fisher's, scientific analysis of love only adds to its magic.” — Scientific American"

http://www.ted.com/speakers/helen_fisher

results.description:
Evening Satsang to celebrate 2578th birthday of Buddha. Let's be inspired...

It is said that wherever Buddha would move, trees would bloom out of season, rivers would start flowing in the summer season when there was no water. Wherever Buddha would move there would be peace, silence, love, compassion, all around. Whenever there is a Buddha something mysterious starts happening. People start blooming out of season, joy spreads, great waves of joy.
OSHO

This day is very unique, Buddha was born, attained enlightenment and left his body on the same full moon day in May. And it is also a beautiful coincidence that when Osho was speaking on Buddhas sutra's the last lecture, the 126th, also ended on the very same full moon day! Read more here

"Let this day also be the birth of a new buddha. The new buddha will be a synthesis of Zorba the Greek and Gautama the Buddha. He cannot be just Zorba, and he cannot be just Buddha" - OSHO

We invite you to celebrate this day of "The Buddha" with meditation and celebration throughout the day.

Please RSVP to confirm your participation.

Suggested Meditation Donations: $10

Any questions: Parimal-[masked]
results.name: Full Moon - Buddha Purnima Celebration

results.description: The Demonsbane party set foot in search of the elf Farlien's whereabouts in the Evermoor forest region of Savage Frontier. The party met some foes from their recent past, the demonic goblins who they discovered were in the employ of the Kraken Society and were involved in kidnapping schemes. The most devastating revelation was that an enemy troop logistical unit with minotaur defenders, orc archers and an orc wizard boss worshipped Orcus, the Demon Prince of the Undead which suggests that Orcus may be the BBEG behind the orc attacks which have plagued the Silver Marches region. A captured prisoner claimed they were preparing an assault on Silverymoon which seemed plausible given the tactical acumen shown by the orcs and their allies. Nonetheless, the party proved highly skilled in dispatching the demonspawn efficiently and quickly. In the next adventure, the party pushes on to the city of Nesme in the western reaches of the Evermoors. Finally, the party cleric had a vivid premonition of a psychic hag that might have clues to offer as to Farlien's recent travels. The party earned 1,025xp, 175gp and 5 slings & ammo from the spoils of combat.
results.name: D&D 5e Silvery Moon

results.description:
Grady who runs Subway Cinema and who does the old school Kung Fu films series and the Super 80's Movie marathons is behind this....this is the press release he sent out about his book, the free beer and of course the movie.

It's time for my new novel to be released! And to celebrate, I want you to come party!

WHAT NOVEL? It's My Best Friend's Exorcism! Set in 1988, at the height of America's Satanic Panic, two kids in South Carolina become convinced that one of them is possessed by the Devil. ThinkBeaches meets The Exorcist.

WHAT PARTY? I'm having a massive party at the Anthology Film Archives to celebrate the release, and you need to be there!

WHEN PARTY? Saturday, May 21 at 6pm sharp!

HOW MUCH? It's $25 and tickets are on sale now!

WHY MONEY? Here's what you get for your $25:

▪ An ultra-rare 35mm screening of TRICK OR TREAT, the amazing 1986 heavy metal horror movie, not available on DVD or Blu-Ray! With cameos from Ozzy Osbourne and Gene Simmons, music by Fastway, and so much backwards masking we're all gonna go to Hell! 

▪ A hardcover copy of My Best Friend's Exorcism! Which retails for $20. Heck, I'll even sign it for you.


▪ A party after the screening with an open bar! Say what? Yes, what! Free beer!


▪ Before the screening I'll be reading, but not from my stupid book. Instead I'll treat you to a quick literary tour of Satanic Scare screeds from the Eighties.

Synopsis:

Character actor Charles Martin Smith directed this quirky horror film about a dead rock star who wreaks vengeance on a small town. When a rock musician is banned from performing at a high school Halloween dance and ends up perishing in a hotel fire, he vows vengeance on the town and comes back from beyond the grave to obliterate the population. He does this through one of his most rabid fans, the nerdy Eddie Weinbauer (Marc Price), a high school outsider. He is such a fan that he plays the rock star's final album "Songs in the Key of Death" in reverse, looking for instructions on how to live his life. The rock star willingly obliges Eddie with helpful hints and soon Eddie is able to face down the high school bullies and gain the attention of an attractive girl. But soon Eddie begins to suspect that the ghost is using him. With the ghost intent on destroying the town, Eddie uses his newfound self-confidence to stand up to the ghost and save the town from destruction.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NHttc38S6kM


This will sell out: get your tix here: http://mybestfriendsexorcism.brownpapertickets.com/

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty-five years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in courts throughout the country, with his office in Long Island, and his concentration in securities and derivative litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).
results.name: Bhagavad-gita Class & Kirtan @ 5:30 p.m. on Saturdays at 26 2nd Avenue, NY, NY

results.description:
RE-SCHEDULED TO 5/21  (due to Memorial Day weekend!): 

Kicking off this Meetup with a classic - F. Scott Fitzgerald's masterpiece, most recently adapted for the big screen by Baz Luhrmann (2013). If you've seen (or plan on watching) the 1974 version (Robert Redford/Mia Farrow), we'll add it to the mix!

About the book: F. Scott Fitzgerald's The Great Gatsby was met with mixed reviews at the time of publishing (1925), revived after WWII and now considered a literary classic. The story is focused on a mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan. About the film(s):
2013 version directed by B. Luhrmann, starring Leonardo DiCaprio. http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1343092/ 1974 version, directed by Jack Clayton, screenplay by F. F. Coppola, staring Robert Redford as Gatsby.
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0071577/?ref_=nv_sr_2 About the Place: The Ten Bells is a cosy, unpretentious Lower East Side wine bar.
http://tenbellsnyc.com/about-the-ten-bells.html.
We'll be in time for the happy hour!

Side note: please read/watch the GG beforehand  (we don't plan to watch the movie during the Meetup), so you can share your thoughts over wine :-)!
results.name: The Great Gatsby @ The Ten Bells

You are cordially invited to Experience the 4th Lucas Adventure Bee –Beyond the Chinese Word

"Dim Sum -Buns or Bonds? "

Date:Saturday, May 21,

Time: 6:00 PM - 7:00PM

Type: Free Community Event

Category:Education

Audience: All 

Lucas Adventure Bee is the One and Only Discovery of Chinese Culture Application Series with the goal to connect, collaborate & celebrate with the community from one word to one world.

Concepts are demonstrated and reinforced through presentations, animation film, drawing, dancing, music, mini debate, and trivia competition. Theme varies each month. And once a while, we will surprise our audience with unexpected prizes and VIPs.

It’s held at every 3rd Saturday from 6pm-7pm at Microsoft Store, 677 Fifth Avenue New York, NY 10022. 

Hope you can join us to Meet, Share & Laugh at the year of the Monkey!


Questions: please e-mail [masked]

See below what we did on 4/19-3rd Event-Kung Fu Panda & Chopsticks 

You

results.description:
Note: YorkShire Towers Location

Session #1 Sold Out & was a big Success so we've added Session #2.

At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackPeopleSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


(Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay using Venmo or Chase QuikPay to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 5pm. YORKSHIRE TOWERS (UES)

• 4/30/16; 5/7/16 ; 5/14/16; 5/21/16; 5/28/16(No Lesson); 6/4/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. 

Come June we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Max 2. Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315
results.name: Yorkshire. #2 I won't drown Swim Challenge - FULL

group.name: ! Black People Who Love The Outdoors and Adventure NY

results.description:
For our next meetup, we'll go to Mass at the oldest Catholic church building in the city, Church of the Transfiguration in Chinatown.

This parish was established in 1853, by then Archbishop John Hughes. The Cuban-born Father Felix Varela, once a parish priest at Old St. Peter's, was the first pastor.

But this church's history began long before then. It was built in 1801 as the Zion Lutheran Church. In 1810, it became the Zion Episcopal Church. Finally in 1853, it became a Catholic Church and it's been one ever since, catering to waves of Irish, Italian and most recently Chinese immigrants.

Mass will be in English, though Cantonese and Mandarin Masses are also offered on Sundays. Social to follow at the Whiskey Tavern, 79 Baxter St.. Plenty of good Chinese restaurants in the neighborhood if you'd like to continue the celebration.

See you there!
results.name: Mass at Transfiguration, social at the Whiskey Tavern

results.name: The Acoustic Cafe is back again!

results.description:
Dear Group Members, 

Thank you very much for coming to our April ‘The Flame’ concert, it was a memorable evening. Now, I’m very proud to announce our May artist of the last season of the series (last concert is in June), the great flamenco-fusion guitarist Alberto Carrión. Directly from Spain and with a very refreshing approach to the flamenco guitar his compositions reflect all of his musical influences, from Jazz to Latin to pop but, trying to maintain the roots of flamenco but infusing it with ‘a little something extra’. Let’s welcome him to The Big Apple with an unforgettable night!!! This concert will be next Saturday MAY 21ST, 6PM - 7-30PM at Cornelia Street Cafe. 

MAY 21ST, 6PM - 7:30PM 

$10 Cover + $10 Minimum 

29 Cornelia Street, Greenwich Village, NY 10014 

For reservations call Cornelia St Café IN ADVANCE at[masked] 19. When making reservations ask to speak with Jonathan. Because the venue is small and it gets really hectic, in order to help the venue's staff be able to sit you all together, I suggest the group meets right outside the venue (or by the bar area) at 5:30 pm... It is not always guaranteed you will be able to sit in the same tables but I can guarantee you will always meet great people at these concerts and will enjoy great music :) 


‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ is a series of jazz flamenco concerts that showcases the work of musicians whose artistic vision, although strongly based in Jazz sounds and approaches, latches onto the roots of Flamenco.

 The fusion of Flamenco with the flavors of the old and new continents not only preserves this genre, but also helps to take it further into the future.
results.name: ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ featuring guitarist Alberto Carrión

results.description:
This meetup is a place for people to come together and play lighter style, party, and social games.  Think games like Settlers of Catan, Ticket to Ride, Betrayal at House on the Hill, The Resistance, or Superfight.  The focus is more on having a good time and meeting new people than playing the most competitive games that exist.  

There is a $5 per person cover charge at this venue, but that includes ample table space, and access to a selection of over 160 games.
results.name: Community Boardgame Meetup

results.description:
In honor of the great musician Prince, we are throwing a purple themed dinner party. His hits will be played while we enjoy purple foods. Your dishes should include at least one purple ingredient. (grapes, cabbage, flowers, food dye, etc.)

To participate you must be willing to bring at least one purple dish to share. If you are need some help coming up with some ideas I have included some recipe links below. Feel free to use any or come up with your own. 


http://www.foodandwine.com/slideshows/purple-foods


http://www.bonappetit.com/recipes/article/12-recipes-for-purple-food-for-breakfast-dinner-appetizers-cocktails-and-summer-treats


Please also contribute something to drink if you wish to drink with us. 

This is a potluck dinner so you should bring your dishes prepared. 

The fine print: 

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of May 21st.  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.
results.how_to_find_us: Additional Details Will be sent to those attending.

results.description:
"ONE OF THE BEST PERFORMANCE POETRY SHOWS OF THE YEAR" -- me, last year


This is our SLAM FINALS, which means 7 of our best and most involved poets from the past year will be competing for the chance to be on our team at the National Poetry Slam and other tournaments. 

Why should you be there?

1) It's going to be a great show. Our best poets are going to be competing in a high-stakes situation. We all bringing our A game.

2) YOU DECIDE. You, as an audience member, will have a chance to help choose who represents our region!

Competing poets will include: Nick Yuk, Nick Nappo, Joseph Quiroz, Wendy Baquerizo, Christine Urio, Kelly Evelyn Gallagher, and Adam Biggs. Bryan Roessel will be emceeing.

Doors @ 6:30 PM; poetry at 7:01.

$5 at the door.
results.name: Poetry Slam Finals @ Casa del Sol in Nyack, NY

For prizes, we have a lot of fishing rods and tackle boxes.  Bait and tackle will also be provided.

results.description:
Join me for an evening of socializing with other devoted theatre goers at The Gallery Players Season Announcement Party.  Seating is open, entertainment is varied, light refreshments will be served and chatting is encouraged!  

Go to galleryplayers.com for tickets, which are $15 each.  

Extraordinary things happen here on 14th Street.  Not only does this theatre company treat us to some of Brooklyn's highest quality productions, but they also provide a summer theatre camp for children without the financial means who learn to act, produce, direct and more.

Let's support this outstanding theatre and their efforts to continue operating. Last year I won a season subscription and 2 other prizes!  All I had to do was drop some tickets in a bag.  Easy!

Bring a little cash for raffles, bring your friends or family and bring your best self.  It'll be a fun evening.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet me at the front door by 6:30, if later then I'll be downstairs
results.name: Penny Social Fundraiser for The Gallery Players

group.name: Bay Ridge Book, Game and Social Club

results.description:
$25 Special Discounted Admission with promo code SAMANTHA. Tickets must be purchased through eventbrite to get discounted price.

($45 Regular Admission).


NOTE: This particular performance is in GERMAN language.


Purchase Tickets here:

https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10075922


Samantha Hoefer, a member of our meetup group who many of you have met on one of our monthly events, will perform and she courteously gave our group a special discount to attend the event. 

Scroll down for more details on the performance.

Find more information about Samantha Hoefer on her website.

Here is a note from Samantha herself:

"Dear Meetup members

I would like to take this opportunity to invite you to the show I am currently cast in. I met many of you Vapiano's for the monthly German meetup, but I would like to pass the information on to the whole Meetup group.
The play I am cast in,  is called "The Other Mozart" and a lot of you have been a great audience during our last run from October till January. We have been touring the show ever since to Texas, New Mexico, Tennessee and I am off to Pittsburgh next week. 
However, we are coming back to NYC from May 6th to June 3rd 2016. With a little special treat. We are going to perform the show in German on two dates, precisely on May 12th (Thursday at 7pm) & on May 21st (Saturday at 7pm).  

At the Players Theatre at 115 MacDougal Street, in the West Village. 
There are also going to be 8 English performances which will be played by either Sylvia Milo or me.. So watch out for Samantha Hoefer performing the role of Nannerl and use discount code SAMANTHA  for the German performances as well as the English ones.
For those of you, who haven't seen the show here is a little more info and a picture for inspiration.


Yours truly,

Samantha Hoefer"

When to be there

I scheduled the event for 6:30pm to ensure everyone is settled by 7:00pm at which the show will start. No one will be seated after 7:00pm sharp.

If you failed to register, you may be able to get regular tickets at 06:30pm if the event is not sold out.

How to get there by subway

A/C/E & B/D/F/M: West 4th St - 1 Block away.

Make sure you check for weekend schedules, not all trains are running on Saturdays.


Accessibility

The event (including the bathrooms) are NOT handicapped accessible. A walk up to the 3rd Floor is required, there is NO ELEVATOR.


The Event

Sylvia Milo's award-winning THE OTHER MOZART, directed by Isaac James Byrne, is the true, untold story of Nannerl Mozart, the sister of Amadeus -- a prodigy, keyboard virtuoso and composer, who performed throughout Europe with her brother to equal acclaim, but her work and her story faded away, lost to history. 

On May 12th, the performance is by Samantha Hoefer and it is in German Language.

Setting & Design

The one-woman drama is set in and on a magnificent 18-foot dress, created to fill and spill over the entire stage. THE OTHER MOZART is based on facts, stories and lines pulled directly from the Mozart family's humorous and heartbreaking letters.

With the opulent beauty of the dress and hair design, the sweet smell of perfume and the clouds of dusting powder rising from the stage, THE OTHER MOZART is a multi-sensual experience that transports the audience into a world of outsized beauty and delight - but also of overwhelming restrictions and prejudice where, finally, this other Mozart tells her story. Period style movement creates a world of opulence and elegance through articulate delicacy of expressive balletic gestures, reverent court bows, and fan language.

Music

Along with music composed by her famous brother and Marianna Martines (a female composer who inspired Nannerl), the play features original music by Nathan Davis and Phyllis Chen --- featured composers of the Mostly Mozart Festival at Lincoln Center, BAM and the International Contemporary Ensemble -- for the instruments Nannerl knew intimately such as clavichords, music boxes and bells, as well as teacups, fans, and other ordinary objects that might have captured her imagination.

The production features music composed by Nathan Davis and Phyllis Chen (of Lincoln Center's Mostly Mozart Festival and the International Contemporary Ensemble) with additional music by Marianna Martines and Wolfgang A. Mozart. Sound design by Nathan Davis. Period style movement directed by Janice Orlandi. Costume design by Magdalena Dabrowska (dress) and Miodrag Guberinic (pannier / corset sculpture), with dress concept by Anna Sroka and hair design by Courtney Bednarowski. Lighting design by Joshua Rose.

Origins & Performances

THE OTHER MOZART was developed at the Piccolo Spoleto festival and at the Cherry Lane Theatre in NYC as part of the All For One Festival. It was presented at the Berkshire and New Orleans Fringe festivals, at Toronto University and in Munich at the Pasinger Fabrik. The play repeatedly returned to Austria in 2014 at the invitation of the Mozarteum Foundation and Mozarteum University in Salzburg. The play had a critically acclaimed Off-Broadway run at the HERE Arts Center in New York City, and in London at St. James Theater. It continues touring internationally.

Awards & Nominations

THE OTHER MOZART was nominated for the 2015 Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Sound Design in a Play and the 2015 Off Broadway Alliance Award for Best Solo Performance. 

The play was nominated for eight New York Innovative Theatre Awards: 

Outstanding Solo Performance - Sylvia Milo, 

Outstanding Director - Isaac Byrne, 

Outstanding Costume Design - Magdalena Dabrowska & Miodrag Guberinic, 

Outstanding Set Design - Anna Sroka, 

Outstanding Sound Design - Nathan Davis, 

Outstanding Original Music - Phyllis Chen & Nathan Davis, 

Outstanding Original Full-length script - Sylvia Milo and 

Outstanding Premiere Production of a Play, 

winning Outstanding Solo Performance and Outstanding Original Music.

Press & Articles

Broadway World (event description largely from here).

The Guardian

The New York Times


The Wall Street Journal


Official Page (see for more articles)

results.description:
To switch things up a bit, please join us as we watch this musical:

Jekyll & Hyde: The Musical approaches the classic Gothic tale from a new angle, finding Dr. Henry Jekyll in an asylum after he's found over the body of the murdered performer Lucy Harris. Dr. Jekyll battles with the monster in his mind, Mr. Hyde, until electroshock therapy brings the two into a final confrontation. Jekyll & Hyde: The Musical asks whether humans are rational creatures, beasts, or perhaps both. Can Jekyll save himself and his humanity, or will Mr. Hyde continue his murderous rampage?

You can buy tickets here. Almost sold out!

results.description:
Our next Saturday Night Dance Social will be held on Saturday, May 21st!

Event Details:

We will have TWO open level dance workshop from 7-9pm. The first workshop will be Cha Cha, which is a flirty Latin dance, this is a wonderful, musically versatile dance, that is great for use at parties and social occasions! We will follow that with a Salsa class from 8-9pm, this is a Flashy Latin dance, that includes fun patterns and fancy footwork!

-No experience is needed, and no partner is necessary!-

-Come out and learn to dance in a fun and relaxed atmosphere!-

After the dance workshop, you will be treated to an array of delicious snacks to keep you energized as we dance the night away! There will also be refreshments, including complimentary wine, and soft drinks.

We will have general dancing, so that we can continue to practice our new moves and dance the night away! We will play a mix of Salsa, Bachata, Cha Cha and Merengue, as well as some Rumba, Hustle and Swing, along with any other music requests!

Please contact Tiffinay at[masked] or at [masked] to RSVP, and with any questions about this event.

Saturday, May 21st- 

6:30pm Doors Open

7-8pm Cha Cha Workshop 

8-9pm Salsa Class 

9-12am Social dancing, refreshments and fun! 

NEW Discounted Admission!


$15, with RSVP, will include your fun dance workshop lessons, refreshments and a night out social dancing!

$20 at the door

You can RSVP for this event below or visit our web-site or Facebook page to RSVP today!

You can also check out the event page on Facebook, Ballroom in Bayside!

results.description:
Angels... The who, what, when of them, and more about these loving beings!!


•   The word ‘angel’ means ‘messenger of God’. 


• Angels are the thoughts of God. 

• Angels are mentioned in different religions but go beyond religion. 

• We all have a guardian angel who has been with us since birth. 

• Angels love us unconditionally. 

• Like angels, God is love and does not condemn. 

• A miracle is a shift of perception from fear to love. 

• Angels are waiting for us to invite them into our life.

Please bring a journal, open spirit and loving heart

results.description:
Vice Versa
325 West 51st (8th and 9th avenue)
Saturday, May 21st
7pm drinks, 8pm dinner
$77 3-course, glass of wine, coffee, tax and tip

NOTE: This dinner is part of my dinner group, The Single Gourmet, there will be 25+ members from that group at this event. Meetup members can join 1-2 events before deciding to join our membership only group. Please pay for this event here, all of our events are prepaid- www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/vice-versa/

The Godfather of scrumptious Italian cucina in New York was a man named Tony May. He had a series of famous Italian restaurants and even operated The Rainbow Room. Vice Versa was started by a Tony May Alumni Group. Started in 1999 and Zagat rated 24, for “top notch Italian cooking in a sleek interior and a pleasant dining experience.” Vice Versa is a NY Magazine Critics top pick stating, “the modern lines of Vice Versa are so (unassuming) it's easy to walk right by its storefront. Do so, and you'll be missing out on one of the most congenial and gratifying restaurants in the theater district, as well as one that's become a whispered neighborhood favorite. Like a hit play that opened with little fanfare, Vice Versa is full of diverting surprises.” Owned by Franco Lazzari and Stefano Terzi, they use only the highest quality ingredients produced locally or imported from Italy. In the kitchen, Stefano makes all pasta from scratch. Stefano’s cooking respects the characteristics of each ingredient and values their qualities in each recipe-a true embodiment of the philosophy of Italian Cuisine. 4.5 stars on Open Table, 4 stars on YELP, Certificate of Excellence from TripAdvisor.

Our menu includes: garden salad with parmigiana, eggplant cannoli filled with ricotta over mixed vegetables, saltimbocca of pork loin with pancetta and sage, beef and pecorino rollatine pizzaiola with tomato, oregano and capers, sesame coated seared salmon with horseradish sour cream and spinach and of course Italian desserts.
results.name: Sold out!!! Vice Versa

results.description:
Full Blue Moon Flower Healing Ceremony & Buddha’s Birthday Celebration - with Vegan Chocolate & Sacred Tea!

NOTE: New location! The Yoga Collective 135 West 29th Street #603 Chelsea NYC

The May Full Moon is called the “Full Flower Moon” for the blossoming and opening of flowers. It is also called the “Mother’s Moon or Milk Moon” for similar reasons of birthing, beauty, and nourishment. This moon is additionally unique as it is a rare BLUE MOON!

It is also a time of celebration for Vesak or Buddha Purnima, the birthday of Buddha on the Full Moon. The full moon in Sagittarius amplifies the desire for freedom, travel, creating new ideas, and having fun! The energy of this moon is perfect for envisioning big picture plans- as the details are not as significant at this time. In this ceremony we will explore the deeper messages of our individual “greater” soul’s path, learn how to use flowers for healing ourselves and others, and honor the “love, peace, and harmony” of the Buddha within.

Healing vegan chocolate and medicinal flower tea to share!


The healing circle will include:
• Opening Ceremony
• Shamanic Drum Journey Meditations
• Learn how to use Flowers for Healing
• Mudras & Satvic Music
• Vegan Chocolate & Tea
• Community LOVE & More!

When: Saturday May 21st Time: 7-9:00 pm
**Please be respectful and arrive on time.

Where: The Yoga Collective
135 West 29th Street #603
Chelsea, NYC

Have a poem, story, or song to share? All is welcome.

Cost: $25
*Bring a friend, get a discount. 2 for $45.


RSVP with paypal for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=QXECEBQLRZFCC

RSVP with paypal for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=DALALQZWDS8M8

Sarah Eve Cardell is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with shaman Izhak Beery and followed with the late shaman Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you.
www.sarahevecardell.com

Amandev is a certified teacher of The Yoga of Awareness in New York City and abroad. Amandev completed a KRI Kundalini Yoga teacher training in NYC with Sat Jivan Kaur and Singh in 2011, is a member of the International Kundalini Yoga Teachers Association, and continued his education to become a Sat Nam Rasayan healer, the art of “deep relaxation in the divine name” with Guru Dev Singh at Mount Shasta through the Center for Contemplative Awareness in Rome, Italy in 2012. Amandev is also a certified Mudra teacher via Sabrina Mesko PHD. He additionally works closely with crystal energy and is a gifted healer, musician, and visual artist, channeling source energy in all that he creates. The name Amandev, translating to “angel of peace that acts as a lion of god”, was received in 2011 by Nirinjan Kaur, Yogi Bhajan’s chief of staff. Amandev emanates his name and a high integrity for truth in all aspects of his life, inspiring and motivating others to connect with their inner joy in harmony with the divine. His goal is to raise global consciousness through love, respect, and abundance.
www.ourinfiniteminds.com

All text, images, and products presented are copyright. Copyright © 2016 Sarah Eve Cardell. All rights reserved.

The Full Moon represents the Goddess in all her many aspects as Mother, full and ripe and bright. When the Moon Full it is the at its greatest power and most potent energies. Come share this time with us. 

A PARTICIPATORY RITUAL WHERE EVERYONE IS A PARTICIPANT.

$15.00 charge in person and $16.00 via paypal (please bring your receipt)

results.description:
Note: Erica G will be hosting this event and the reservation is under her name. Food will be ordered family style and the bill evenly split. You will be responsible for paying for any drinks that you order. Thanks.


The Place: Fresh seafood, some still wriggling in the pot, is the draw at this no-frills Korean restaurant.


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 


Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks. 

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.

results.description:
We’d love to sing with you! We’re are thrilled to host Nina Rao as she leads us in her divine singing of the sacred sounds from the Sanskrit tradition. These ancient sounds were revealed to the yogis as doorways to our deepest truth and grace. All are welcome to sing or just enjoy being in the vibe. We’ll have great music, homemade chai, pot-luck treats, and a whole lot of love!

No experience necessary and no yoga mat needed; just come dressed comfortably to sit or move and we’ll supply the rest.

Ticket Price: By Donation ($20 Suggested, no one turned away)

Nina Rao learned traditional chants (bhajans) from her grandfather in a village in south India when she nine years old. The chants quietly stayed with her until she rediscovered chanting with Krishna Das in New York in 1996. For many years Nina has been Krishna Das' business manager and assistant, often touring with him playing cymbals and singing. In 2007, she recorded the track 'Nina Chalisa' on Krishna Das' CD "Flow of Grace " and in January 2013, she released her debut album, "Antarayaami - Knower of All Hearts". Nina regularly leads kirtan, chanting of the Hanuman Chalisa, and sings for yoga classes in her hometown of Brooklyn, NY and beyond.
results.name: Kirtan w Nina Rao and Friends!

results.description:
This is the one!  Help us celebrate our FIFTH MEETUP ANNIVERSARY!!!


Join us for an awesome night of music!


Welcome to all our new members! You add another dimension to our music! An outstanding blend of instruments and vocals all contributed to the awesome sound of some of the best music we've played! We'll be at Classic Quiche in Teaneck again, where the seats are comfortable & the music is hot!

Come early @ 6:00 PM and have dinner! For the full menu, go to www.classicquiche.com.  Experience has shown that all goes smoothly, if only the voices and bass plug in and the rest is acoustic. Do bring mics if you have them.  By all means, if you're playing a solo or finger-picking, temporary amplification is fine! 
We are a friendly, inviting and inclusive group--so join us! 
Download our latest BCAM Songbook by clicking on MORE then FILES section of the Meetup site.

**NOTES 
The restaurant doesn't have a liquor license, so BYOB!

A $5 cover charge will be collected from musicians, 100% of which goes to the venue. 

FOR ALL OTHERS, A $10 MINIMUM FOOD/BEVERAGE CHARGE WILL APPLY**
results.how_to_find_us: www.classicquiche.com/

results.description:
The summertime Gluten Free Wine & Dessert Nights are back! Join Jessica for a special evening at Davio's Northern Italian Steakhouse. 

Davio's has an extensive gluten free menu, and the staff is extremely aware of the needs of their gluten free patrons. "Throughout service we use separate silverware and serving ware and we control every surface that we use to avoid any cross contamination. There is a strict process in place and we make sure we train all our staff to adhere to it every day."

For more info visit www.davios.com/nyc

Gluten Free Wine & Dessert Night at Davio's

415 Lexington Ave, near 45th St

Saturday May 21st

7:30 pm

***UPDATED***

Purchase tickets here:

https://davios.com/nyc/events/gluten-free-wine-dessert-night


$25 includes featured dessert & drink of choice and tax. Tip is not included and must be paid for at the event. 

Choice of Beverage:

Peachitini Cocktail  Caposaldo Pinot Grigio

Dante Alighieri Rubino del Marchese Toscana

Choice of Gluten-Free Dessert:

Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta,  Seasonal Berries Flourless Chocolate Cake, Gelato

*Disclaimer: the NYC Celiac Disease Meetup Group and its event organizers cannot be held responsible for any negative reaction that you may experience from food/drink at an event. It is always up to the individual attendees to make decisions regarding where and what they eat. This is not your home kitchen, so remember it is eat at your own risk.

results.name: Made in New York Online Jazz Competition 3rd Annual International Jazz Gala

results.description:
The Made In New York Jazz Gala became one of the most significant International jazz events in New York, featuring legendary Jazz Artists. This year we celebrate our 3rd Annual, International Jazz Gala. The winner of the competition João Barradas, one of the most recognized young accordionists in Europe, will be performing this year.


Rufus Reid, one of today’s premiere bassists on the international jazz scene, with his reputation firmly established in the education arena.

Tommy Campbell (known for his work with Dizzy Gillespie, Sonny Rollins and others), Philip Harper (The Jazz Messengers and Charles Mingus Big Band), Bobby Sanabria 7 times Grammy award nominee, composer, arranger, educator and writer specializing in Latin jazz. Yaacov Mayman, art director of the competition (Yaacov has performed and/or recorded with Joe Lovano, Benny Golson, Ray Santiago and others).

The host of the GALA 2016 will be George V Johnson Jr., one of the most recognizable jazz voices who mentored and performed regularly with “James Moody & Lou Donaldson”.

Special guest from Italy: Federico Malaman! Internet sensation and one of the most watched jazz, fusion bass players on YouTube and social media.
Some of his videos performing have well over a million views, displaying great musicianship and a technical ability that is jaw dropping.

The front runners of the competition will also perform on the gala:
Karim Maurice a pianist, composer and arranger from France. Giulia Malaspina, Italian pianist, composer and arranger graduated from Berklee College of Music.
Our finalists the Next Step Quintet from Greece and Brazilian pianist Diogo Monzo.
results.name: Jazz Gala @ Tribeca

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

The fee is a love donation of $5 to $10, and something to eat or drink that is vegan for the group to share  We do need each person to bring something.
CALL US IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT TO BRING!

8:00 pm Introductions
8:30 pm Talk & Discussion, Songs, chants, stories, Peace meditation
9:30 pm Being in Community - sharing food, meeting friends, etc.

Fee for the evening is your contribution of vegan food to share and/or a suggested $10 donation.

RSVP by Sat, 5pm. [masked]

Satsang in Indian philosophy means (1) the company of the "highest truth," (2) the company of a guru, or (3) company with an assembly of persons who listen to, talk about, and assimilate the truth. This typically involves listening to or reading scriptures, reflecting on, discussing and assimilating their meaning, meditating on the source of these words, and bringing their meaning into one’s daily life. Contemporary spiritual teachers in the West frequently come from the East but can come from any part of the world.

The idea of satsangam was first spread by ancient Rishis such as Vedavyasa and Valmiki who explained its value in numerous ways.

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 3 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - 


RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game.

I am not reserving 2 spots per game for any new players who have not played with us yet.

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.

Throughout May, Rawiya -- the first Middle Eastern female photography collective -- presents their exhibit In Her Absence I Created Her Image at Open Source Gallery. In collaboration with Open Source Gallery, and inspired by the Rawiya Collective, The Creators Collective presents a series of performances from dance and theater artists at the gallery. The works performed are either inspired by the photographs in the exhibit, the meaning of Rawiya which is “she who tells a story” or the Rawiya Collective’s goal of dispelling stereotypes to encourage a more compassionate and empathetic worldview. 

This evening of performances is part of the fifth phase of our Collective Storytelling Program: a series of performances based in storytelling and identity. 

MORE INFORMATION: 
Rawiya Collective - rawiya.net
Open Source Gallery - open-source-gallery.org
Collective Storytelling - thecreatorscollective.org/storytelling
results.name: SHE WHO TELLS A STORY: An evening of performance

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, May 21st for a Downton Abbey inspired dinner party in Bushwick! The year is 1912. The Titanic has just set sail for New York from England, yet to meet its fateful end. Parliament has introduced an Irish Home Rule bill. The aristocracy still enjoys a life of supreme privilege, residing in country manors and stately homes, surrounded by dutiful servants. Yet the wheels of democracy are moving slowly forward and life, as the nobility have known it, is beginning to change…. Join us for a splendid spring dinner party complete with parasols, Pimm’s Cups and punch. Dinners can expect classic dishes straight from the aristocratic tables of the old school nobility. 

Dishes like Galantine of Chicken, Consommé Royale, Whole Baked Haddock in Sharp Sauce, frothy Champagne ices and an Eton-y-inspired Mess. Each course will be paired with delectable Old World wines and stories of historical intrigue: How divided were upstairs and downstairs? Who were the most gossip-worthy socialites of the period? What was shaking the confidence of the old order?

Dinner to take place at 8pm on Saturday, May 21st, 2016 at Café Ghia in Bushwick, Brooklyn. Tickets are $120 each plus tax and available for purchase here:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-world-of-downton-abbey-tickets-25035153819 See you at dinner!
results.name: Edible History Presents: The World of Downton Abbey

results.description:
We did this Meetup a couple of months ago and got such a great turn out that we're doing it again!

Make a new friend, network, or meet that special someone! Since it's always easier to meet people when you're with someone, we're asking that you try to bring at least one person with you (friend, roommate, colleague etc). 

And the best part, they get in for FREE (each ticket is good for up to 2 people)!! 

P.S. It's not mandatory that you bring someone but highly encouraged! 

*GET TICKETS HERE

*First 20 tix just $10 w/ discount code FRIEND at checkout.

What to expect:

• 2 For 1 Drinks (8:30-9:30pm)

• DJ on lower level spins best dance music 

• VJ on upper level plays videos at conversational level

• Icebreakers & Snacks 

• Prizes & Giveaways 

• FREE shot if it's your birthday month (show ID at door)

*GET TICKETS HERE 

(First 20 tix just $10 w/ discount code FRIEND at checkout)

$15 after that online, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o

Can I come alone? Yes. The ice breakers will help you meet other members. So come alone or bring a friend or two - either way you will feel comfortable and have a great time. 

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Group members can invite guests to join them.  

What's dress code? No sweats, hats, etc Jeans ok. Dress stylish. 

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event is not age or ethnic specific. We will have a wide mix of ages (21-50s). 

How many will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales already, we will have up to 200 members attending.

results.description:
Join "The NYC Myers-Briggs Type Indicator Meetup Group" for dinner.

Host:  Chloe (ENFP) 

Greet old friends and meet new one.  

Rain or shine after the afternoon Bryant Park meetups, a group of hardcore enthusiasts go to dinner and drinks together.  Led by our Chief Party Officer, Chloe (ENFP).  RSVP count needed as soon as possible for reservations with restaurant.

Proposed Agenda 

8:30 - Tony's di Napoli, 43rd/Broadway, $$, 147 W 43rd St, New York, NY 10036, (212)[masked], family style, https://goo.gl/maps/41rHn7aDjyJ2 

11:30 - The House of Brews, 51st/8th, 302 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, $11 cocktails, 100 beers, (212)[masked], https://goo.gl/maps/m9dqZdrvaaD2 

***********

Meet real life examples of your personality type...this maybe how you come across to others! :D 

Meet others personality types and find out what they like or dislike about your "personality type's" patterns! :( 

Prerequisite: Take the online test and read your personality description. How well does your personality type description fit you? 

http://www.humanmetrics.com/cgi-win/JTypes2.asp 

ISTJ - Duty Fulfillers http://www.celebritytypes.com/istj.php 
ESTJ - Guardians        http://www.celebritytypes.com/estj.php 
ISFJ - Nurturers          http://www.celebritytypes.com/isfj.php 
ESFJ - Caregivers        http://www.celebritytypes.com/esfj.php 
ISTP - Mechanics http://www.celebritytypes.com/istp.php 
ESTP - Doers http://www.celebritytypes.com/estp.php 

ESFP - Performers http://www.celebritytypes.com/esfp.php 
ISFP - Artists http://www.celebritytypes.com/isfp.php 
ENTJ - Executives http://www.celebritytypes.com/entj.php 
INTJ - Scientists http://www.celebritytypes.com/intj.php 
ENTP - Visionaries http://www.celebritytypes.com/entp.php 
INTP - Thinkers http://www.celebritytypes.com/intp.php 
ENFJ - Givers  http://www.celebritytypes.com/enfj.php 
INFJ - Protectors        http://www.celebritytypes.com/infj.php 
ENFP - Inspirers          http://www.celebritytypes.com/enfp.php 
INFP - Idealists            http://www.celebritytypes.com/infp.php 

April's meetup:  Approx. 14+ Extroverts, 32+ Introverts, and 1 unknown type attended. Approx. number of attendees by personality type (Type Frequency in Population by %)/ #Showed...# Past Meetups:

ISFJ (13.8%) /0...Past 1,0,0,1,0,0,1, 1,0 
ESFJ (12.3%)/2...Past 1,0,0,0,0,0,2,0,2 
ISTJ (11.6%) /2...Past 3,1,1,1,0,0,1, 0,0 
ISFP (8.8%) /1...Past 1,1,1,1, 1,0,0,1,2 
ESTJ (8.7%)/0...Past 0,0,0,0,0,1,3,0,0 
ESFP (8.5%)/0...Past 1,0,0,0,0,0,1,0 
ENFP (8.1%)/6...Past 3,6,3,4+,3+,2,4,5,4 
ISTP (5.4%)/0...Past 1,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0 
INFP (4.4%)/4...Past 2,1+7,3+,1+,3,2,5,5 
ESTP (4.3%)/0...Past 0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0 
INTP (3.3%)/5...Past 5,7,5,2,4,4,4,1,2 
ENTP(3.2%)/4...Past 1,3,4,3,2,3,4,3,1 
ENFJ (2.5%)/1...Past 1,1,0,1,4,1,3,4,2 
INTJ (2.1%) /12..Past 6,5,8,4+,4+,5,10,12,10 
ENTJ (1.8%)/1...Past 4,1,1,2,0,1,3,2,4 
INFJ (1.5%) /8...Past 7.2,5,3+,3,4,8,4 
???? /1..............Past 0,4,0,1,2, 1, ?, ? ?

A total of 47 trickled in through the afternoon & evening, and over 20 hardcore enthusiasts went out for dinner & drinks afterward.

Personality Type Distribution in the General Population.  Data source: "MBTI Manual" published by CPP

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9qh78adRniU&feature=youtu.be

As Lolas 

Five beautiful ladies and killer musicians who joined forces to bring back a lost era of Brazilian music that's now only found on vinyl! It's rock and roll with screaming guitars, thundering drums, funkafied bass lines and thick vocal harmonies. Ever since the band's first concert at Harlem’s “Shrine” in February of 2014, As Lolas have been taking NYC by storm. The band has appeared at major NYC venues like SOB’s, Nublu and Brooklyn Bowl, to name a few, and also toured Europe in 2014 and 2015. 

AS LOLAS are: Fabiana Masili (vox/perc, also Nation Beat), Eliane Amherd (guit/voc, also Swiss Misses), Viva DeConcini (guit/voc, also Beat The Donkey), Dawn Drake (bass/voc, also ZapOte), and Rosa Avila (drums, also Andy Williams). 

Their shows feature the best of Brazilian psychedelic rock, easily recognizable to Americans with sounds of The Mamas & The Papas, The Monkees, The Byrds, The Zombies, Jefferson Airplane, The Animals, etc, covering songs by Os Mutantes, Secos e Molhados, Raul Seixas, Tom Zé, and Rita Lee, to name a few -- as well as composing their own songs and producing a spectacular vibe!

This Saturday they'll feature Eliane Amherd, opening the show with her CD release performance + special guest Elin (Thievery Corporation vocalist & former lead singer of Alma Tropicalia), as well as Fabiana Masili's birthday celebration!!

Doors 8pm, show 8:30pm, cover $10 

(Pay at the door or Buy Tickets here)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=09VtEI9IfRU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eo3LGyvKVjE
results.name: 60's & 70's Brazilian Psychedelic Rock Saturday in the Meatpacking District!

Prepay required HERE


 Men ages: 33-45
Wom ages: 31-44


Cost: $35.75 - $40.75

Part 1- Informal mingle to meet others attending and make some new friends as our host introduces you to others during this group aspect of the event . 

Part 2- Up to 15 connections in one night, each lasting 4-6 minutes long.  After each round, you will circle yes or no on your scorecard as to whether or not you would be interested in corresponding with that person further.

Part 3- Everyone is welcomed to stay and mingle get to know each other more.  Besides meeting potential people for romance potential, many attendees have made some terrific new friends and business potentials. 

At the end of the evening you will turn in your scorecard for us to tally.  The next morning you will receive an email letting you know who you matched with.  The email will provide you with the person's first name and email address and they will get your first name and email address.  We even let you know the one way matches (they picked you, but you didn't pick them), just in case you change your mind.

Prepay required HERE

results.description:
Dear Group,

The Dancers Who Care Dance-a-Thon is an event at the JCC that benefits women LIVING with cancer

It's a 3 hour event at the JCC that highlights several dance styles for 45 mins each.

People are encouraged to come and try out a dance style with a professional and the dance community at large for a good cause.


A "Lindy Bomb" is a term within the swing dancing community that targets a dance event that is NOT swing, and swing dancers show and dance the Lindy Hop. Its very fun. This year I am going to take over the DJ booth for a spell and play some of my favorites!

It's a wonderful floor and space and its for a great cause that gives people living with cancer a free Spa day.


As you can see by the schedule, the "ballroom" section is at 9pm. Please join us


See the Facebook event page here:

https://www.facebook.com/events/844152699063095/?active_tab=highlights


Thanks and hope to see you soon,

Spencer

PS please feel free to come at 7:30pm and enjoy ALL the dance styles featured

results.description:
***Due to the popularity of the event, the venue has been changed to SkyRoom, one of the best rooftops in Manhattan, with amazing night view of Manhattan skyline. We expect as many as 200 guests for this awesome Chinese event***

Shanghai in 1930 was considered the “Paris of the East”, renowned for its chic Cheongsam style dress, a modernized form-fitting fashion popular among socialites and upper crust of high society in China.  Still an icon of elegance and sophistication, Cheongsam style is memorably worn by legendary Chinese beauty Angie Chiu  in “Shanghai Bund” （上海滩）。 

To celebrate Asia heritage month, Trendy New York is proud to present “Cheongsam Night out – A date with Cheongsam beauties in Shanghai Bund 1930”. VIP guests include Chinese beauties queens from varies pageants, supermodels, bankers and executives from large corporations. A truly wonderful night to travel back to Shanghai 1930 and enjoy the elegance and beauty of Cheongsam, with unique Cheongsam fashion show and amazing old Shanghai music. 

We'll present 5 Trendy New York Awards to the best dressed guests and give away three amazing gifts to our guests. Please bring business cards for free giveaways. 
* Trendy New York "Cheongsam Beauty" Award: Winner will receive $200 beautiful Jade 
* Trendy New York "Shanghai Bund" Award: Winner will receive $180 gold-plated MUNITO earphones 
* Trendy New York "Classic Beauty" Award: Winner will receive $105 makeup/hairstyling package gift card 
* Trendy New York "Best Look" Award: Winner will receive  $88 Shanghai 1930 beautiful purse 
* Trendy New York "Best Dressed" Award: Winner will receive Lapeau Facial & SPA gift card 

Free Trendy Giveaways： 
* $105的makeup/hair styling礼券 (赞助商：Cakra Fashion Makeup &Skincare）Winner will receive $105 makeup/hairstyling package gift card 
* $88的水晶iPhone Case（赞助商： 时尚纽约） Winner will receive $88 crystal iPhone Case                                                
* Lapeau Facial & SPA礼券（赞助商：Lapeau SPA)Winner will receive Lapeau Facial & SPA gift card(Prizes are subject to changes)                                                                  

Part of the event profits will be used for sponsoring China alumni related events in New York and promote Sino-U.S. economy and cultural exchange. Trendy New York was proud to sponsor Zhejiang University Alumni 2015 Chinese New Year gathering. Great thanks to the following sponsors: Shiseido, Godiva, MUNITO, Forever Wedding Studio, Cakra Fashion Makeup &Skincare and Lapeau SPA and New York City Business Owners Network. 

Agenda（5／16 9pm- 12am)

9:00 pm: 
Red carpet and networking (Professional photographer will take photos of all guests )                

10:00 pm: 
Cheongsam fashion show and Cheongsam Beauty Awards Ceremony

9pm－10pm: 
(The event entry is from 9-10pm and no more entry after 10pm)

Dress Code: Cocktail Attire in Shanghai 1930 Style (Cheongsam is strongly recommended for women)

See you at Shanghai Bund, 1930 @ Skyroom! 
Trendy New York Team 

(Trendy New York is an international fashion and lifestyle consultant group that enhances business and culture, connecting high net worth Chinese between the United States and China. Trendy New York and its Cheongsam Charity Gala have been featured in Vogue, New York Times, the Huffington Post, NHK Network and many other international media.) 
  Please get your event tickets NOW 
on the famous EventBrite.com web site: 
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-night-of-glamor-and-intrigue-at-shanghai-bund-in-1930-skyroom-516-skyroom8-tickets-16389970844?discount=NYCBusinessOwners
