results.description:
What’s up ya’ll?! We are about to hit ya’ll with some Batman type shit! Late night, possibly on a rooftop in Gotham. This is only meant for the bold.


The goal… Get to Katz’s Deli. That is admittedly an easy task but we will add some designated obstacles to this whole shebang. With the LES bringing everything great in NYC together in one space this is creates that perfect playground for planning an amazing food crawl curated with beer, spirits and great food.


The setup: We will be starting at Jerome’s @ Rivington F+B … (A place I was nearly burned alive last year) for some starter kit drinks and tunes. From there we will move (when ready) to “The Delancey” for a tap tap salute toast and possibly some live music. We might then grab a slice from the grand “Rizzo’s Fine Pizza” and then try to creep into a bar hidden below a “Toy Company”.


The ride will continue from there until we get that golden ticket... you know; the one you get when you enter the aged doors @ Katz’s Deli. The place where amazing musicians like the Ramones used to go in the dead of night after amazing performances for dope food... Or dope and food.


A time honored Jewish deli since 1888; Katz’s is the pinnacle of the greatest food in NYC and you will be there for the ride challenged to officially finish your damn sandwich!!

Join us for what will be a historical night with CF on the LES.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet us in front of Jeromes at 9:30. We will enter the realms of debauchery from there.
results.name: The Crawl To End It All… [L.E.S.]

results.description:
BACHATA Night!

May 21st!! NYC! Take advantage of workshop x party x performances!! 

Learn the authentic style from Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic!! 

Presenting Juan Mejia from Bachata Fix DR, bringing you a special footwork workshop! Open level but should have an understanding of the basics. Learn the patterns and how to apply them on the floor & with your partner. 

     Check him out getting down at Central Park 

https://www.facebook.com/bachadura/videos/vb.1614271925513790/1715561458718169/?type=2&theater¬if_t=video_comment¬if_id=[masked]


DJs: Brian "EL MATATAN", Young Maestra and Milton "EL TOLETE"

                   @ 10: 00pm SPECIAL FOOTWORK by Juan Mejia

                                       **This is BYOB Studio**

• Complimentary Drink and Snacks

What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.

Have a Birthday Coming up! Contact us to do your Bday Party.


                               More information: 

https://www.facebook.com/events/663744417058409/

results.description:
Beginners welcome!  Free snacks, BYOB.  Learn fundamentals of Bachata & Merengue, two distinct dance styles popularized in the Dominican Republic.  Think you're already experienced?  Well come with an open mind because "the day you stop learning is the day you stop living"!  Come through & show what you can do, because after the class the party continues all night with DJs spinning bachata + merengue + salsa.  

This is not a free event.  $8 admission until 10:30pm; increases after that.

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP opens on Friday at 8:30am and closes at 9pm on Saturday evening.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. 

- Rmbr, it's a early morning game. Therefore, if you can't make it, change your RSVP well BEFORE Saturday 9pm to give enough notice for anyone on the waitlist. Changing your RSVP after 9pm will also mean a 2 weeks ban.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

Absolutely no exceptions to these rules.


PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Try It You'll Like It and if you do, sign up and start your lessons the same day. We'll credit your try SCUBA payment towards the class and give.

For anyone who wants to test the waters, this is the Scuba Discovery Program. It gives you a glimpse into what you can expect to see in the underwater world as well as what you could expect to learn in the Scuba Diver Course. You will be shown the basic safety procedures for scuba diving under the watchful eye of an instructor. You will learn skills like equalizing your ears, buddy checks, basic buoyancy control, underwater communication and an introduction to basic scuba equipment and scuba skills followed by an underwater dive in the pool. If you enjoy this experience then the Open Water Scuba Diver course is your next step.

Need more info? Call the Dive Center[masked]

What's Required?

• A curiosity about scuba diving

• A swimsuit and a towel

If you have a mask, snorkel, and fins, bring them.

If not, we'll loan you ours – we will provide everything else!

If all spots are filled get on the waiting list we may run a 2nd session that day

Cost: $25.00 Click to Pay Now!  (Get a $25 credit for your Lessons)

If at the end of the session you are ready to start. You can sign up on the spot and hop right back in.

Just bring a bathing suit and towel and leave everything else to us!

IMPORTANT:

Please print and complete the following three forms to bring to the pool

•  Student Information Form

• SDI General Waiver for all Courses

• SDI Medical Info Waiver

*Physician Sign-Off Form This form MUST BE COMPLETED if the answer to ANY question on the "Medical Info Waiver form is YES before participating

Please note that the entrance to the pool where "Try Scuba" is being held is located in the rear parking lot of the Lodi Boys and Girls Club.

results.description:
This is a ride for all levels and it's just 25 miles roundtrip, although it does have some hills!  We visit the Storm King Art Center which is a large park with a lot of large sculptures!  It's a really unique place and a must visit!  We take a long train ride up to Beacon (1  1/2 hours), departing Grand Central at 8:43 AM and getting in at about 10:15 AM.  From there we will ride up a mile into the quaint little town of Beacon for just a short coffee and bathroom break before heading toward Storm King.  We'll take it slow and arrive in Cornwall, another cute town for lunch before heading to Storm King.  When we get to Cornwall we can decide if we want to eat there or do a picnic type deal at the park.  It takes a while to take in the park because it covers a large area and they don't let you use your bike to ride around!  If you have clip in shoes bring walking shoes also.  There is an entrance fee of $15 to get into Storm King.

Here's a link to Storm King   http://stormking.org/visit/

Here's the cue sheet (we'll return a slightly different way so its slightly less mileage back and less hilly).  https://goo.gl/5z4Ut8

Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

results.description:
7th Annual Orchard Beach Clean-up & Clam Bake </a><a href="http://www.meetup.com/Pristine-Azul-Dive-Club/photos/8461192"></a><a href="http://www.meetup.com/Pristine-Azul-Dive-Club/photos/8461192"><a href="http://www.meetup.com/Pristine-Azul-Dive-Club/photos/8461192"></a>

The members of Pristine Azul enjoy taking dive trips to exotic getaway locations or diving here in NJ off the many dive boats, which are dreamy and fun. Imagine if these places that we dive were polluted or littered with trash. How enjoyable would that be? Well, that is where Pristine Azul comes in for the rescue.

Pristine Azul Diving will be teaming up with Dive Clubs from New Jersey and New York, to assist with the 7th Annual Orchard Beach Clean-up located in the Bronx, NY, on May 22, 2013. The cleanup will take place along Orchard Beach's sandy shores. This year's clean-up will focus on the beach, underwater, and grassy areas. There will be a booth on the beach walkway to get your bag, gloves, and a map to the area that you will be assigned to.

(Yes this is an old flyer. I'm waiting for the new one, but wanted to get this out to everyone.)

Diver registration starts at 9:00 AM and Beach cleaners at 10:0AM. Follow the signs to the left side of the Orchard Beach parking lot. Transfer trucks will be there to transport the gear of those who are diving. This clean-up is for divers and non-divers alike, so bring the family and enjoy more than just a day at the beach.

Afterwords celebrate your efforts at the get–together to follow the clean–up! This all day event opens to the public at 10:00 am. Prizes will be awarded for the most trash collected, the most unusual trash found, and many more door prizes for helping with the clean–up.

After the beach clean–up there will be a clam bake and barbecue until dusk. Be sure to bring your favorite beverages.

I believe that we as a club, we can help those that want to help the diving environment make a difference in keeping our beaches and oceans clean. So PLEASE if you can join us along with other club's members to help clean-up what we enjoy so much.

Like always please RSVP!!! Early RSVPs will help us to let the Organizers know how many people are coming to help.

results.name: 7th Annual Orchard Beach Clean-up

results.description:
This meetup is for May 22! There is no game for May 15th as all the organizers are busy. Good games last week. The rain did stop when we started to play. Thanks to all that showed up and play.

Angry Papa Chris was on fire last week but it certainly helped that newcomer Nick was catching everything thrown his way. Z had all the heart in the world but his ankle couldn't carry him to where the ball was.


RSVP and show up on time!

Thank you.

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
Volunteers are needed to help out with a food drive for Bread of Life food pantry!  Bread of Life provides food to families and over 17 church & government food pantries and shelters throughout southern Westchester County.  Come be a part of this great organization for the day (or weekend)!


When:  Sat May 21st and Sun May 22

The food drive will be held from 9am to 5pm on both days. 


Where:  Stop & Shop, 152 Westchester Ave, White Plains, NY

Any time you can help out is appreciated!  Please write the time you plan to volunteer in the comments after you rsvp.  =)

About Bread of Life:  Bread of Life is a Rye, NY based not-for-profit organization committed to serving our neighborhood. It is the only food rescue organization, which also has its own on-site food pantry. We pick up locally and deliver free of charge to neighborhood food pantries, soup kitchens and shelters, serving over 9,000 hungry weekly. Bread of Life receives its food supplies from various sources, but one unique source is donations by local businesses of excess food that would otherwise be discarded as waste.  Bread of Life’s beneficiaries are not only physically hungry, but are also in need of assurance that their lives are matter.

**All minors must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.  Thanks!**

results.description:
The core of the oven is built, but we're not done yet! Learn the basics of masonry and lay bricks to build the outer facing of the oven.

Join the team to lay the beautiful red brick facing that will make this oven a twin to the Old Stone House and protect it for generations to come.  We'll also be beautifying the oven area.

This final phase of oven construction will extend over several weekends throughout the month of May. Feel free to join all day long or for just a couple of hours. No prior bricklaying experience is required!

Also, when you come help build the oven, we'll add your name to the brass dedication plaque that will be put on the finished oven. You'll go down in history as a Builder of the Oven!

We'll provide work gloves and tools.  Please wear closed-toe shoes and clothes that can get dirty.

See you there!

results.description:
Join us for the third hike in the series to again trace the entire historic route of the Morris Canal!
This time, we will be hiking between Woodland Park near Paterson and Newark!
AND...for added fun ;)
This will be a THEME HIKE...although not a requirement, many of us are going to try to do this hike in scrubs (like nurses, doctors wear, etc.)


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xft1/v/t1.0-9/11214708_890968664273006_8943483473978888667_n.jpg?oh=ffc98fa2dc1f8c612b721a389903a96d&oe=57862530

After meeting, we will shuttle with as few cars as possible to a grocery store with larger parking several blocks from the former canal route. We'll then begin to trace the canal from Branch Brook Park.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/283434_10150254323676777_5872973_n.jpg?oh=f47e771260c0f7c7d76ae074914bac1b&oe=577FD36F

The trail follows an odd greenway behind houses and such as we head into Belleville, then we follow the former route along some roads.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/269020_10150254323461777_3530615_n.jpg?oh=ad0cbebb33d342b95c1494cedb87a1f4&oe=5775289C

We then pass through Wright's Field, a section where the route but not the prism has been preserved to some extent.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-0/p206x206/267537_10150254323241777_618855_n.jpg?oh=868541e78583397e20c46aa07e1284dc&oe=578830C6

A good short trail section follows from here to the site of a former aqueduct, from which we must walk another section of parallel streets where it has been developed over.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/281295_10150254300426777_7907823_n.jpg?oh=75660c3e809dcb34f1b22a7b98489056&oe=578DF888

As we head into Bloomfield, it becomes apparent how the former canal has shaped modern day development, as we cross different lots and such, then pass over the Garden State Parkway.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/270710_10150254299716777_4800410_n.jpg?oh=e188683c86781a34112f168d8bb45512&oe=577D5A35

Some of JFK Parkway has been built INSIDE the canal, and so we will walk along that, as well as parallel streets in through Bloomfield.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/281760_10150254331581777_567324_n.jpg?oh=dd4a39b9ae1ff6e785d4822f88784673&oe=57855B6F

Once there, we may be touring an historic home that was associated with the canal at former Inclined Plane #11 East.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/270745_10150254297896777_656216_n.jpg?oh=00378be0e28ef2a637b46e1e3c6d08c3&oe=57B9924B

We'll continue tracing the route rather closely on modern streets heading to the north, roughly parallel with the Parkway, and using one of the pedestrian bridges that will be part of the official greenway (this is also Lenape Trail).


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/281650_10150254296421777_7363318_n.jpg?oh=c73f102162dc7ef3697692a48fd48285&oe=5787A216

We continue north through urban areas, but also from time to time will get on well preserved portions of the canal, which may come as a surprise to those who have heard it was destroyed by the parkway.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/283080_10150254296146777_6211935_n.jpg?oh=f2c645638e1586b0954a4bf43c6c9b8f&oe=5779BC0E

We'll continue north, and one of the best parts is a stretch of the canal we will have permission to cross, through the Upper Montclair Country Club. At first the towpath is very rustic and well preserved.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/283232_10150254329801777_2740126_n.jpg?oh=7be79194b2541908cd824bcf386b6e18&oe=578166BB

We'll then reach the golf course, and we are working on permission to hike this particular section. We have not secured it yet, and this is NOT a guaruntee that we can go through, but if it works out, it will be wonderful


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/269825_10150254329611777_6907935_n.jpg?oh=1b952f343af2d3f392aede7d5509430d&oe=577DDA2C

It's quite amazing how much there still is to see of the former route.
If we are not able to walk across, the plan is we will walk parallel roads around the outside.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/268145_10150254294501777_8369027_n.jpg?oh=7b054955942259809558db97ab5fac6a&oe=5776C058

Upper Montclair Country Club is private land and no one should trespass without special permission to go across their lands. There are also state police lands, and again we are still working on securing permissions. I will add updakes in comments.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/270240_10150254294316777_2596890_n.jpg?oh=84c7c4afc703629777cab49491890e43&oe=578D70EB

We'll continue from the Country Club on a road walk section over some of the bigger highways, then pick up the former route again on the other side.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/270240_10150254294316777_2596890_n.jpg?oh=84c7c4afc703629777cab49491890e43&oe=578D70EB

The next bit of the greenway is within Jubilee Park, and will be an out and back section because there is no access to cross over the Parkway where the canal once crossed.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-frc3/v/t1.0-9/267685_10150254293976777_6044909_n.jpg?oh=657b8ff66631b7d92d84aed100a705b1&oe=57784A5B

We'll cross over the Parkway at a nearby road, then continue north through the Bloomfield Canal Park, one of he finest preserved sections of the Morris Canal in it's entire eastern section.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/267565_10150254293456777_7787205_n.jpg?oh=26cc74870f59fcd02bf5ef839790c31c&oe=57BCA33C

Despite the fact that the park ends, we'll still manage to get on more of the canal parallel with buildings and such as we head north.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/v/t1.0-9/282135_10150254293151777_3255904_n.jpg?oh=9fc7e26440e68d981daca201767c35ed&oe=57B92D62

There are some pretty  nice sections immediately parallel with the highway, where many seem to think it was developed over.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/270395_10150254292921777_4084879_n.jpg?oh=9ca8367f8186c2c2ea9ce009bba02595&oe=57B9F9E7

As we head into Paterson, we will remain as close as we can to the canal route, or just below it. Some roads are built over it today. We'll have to walk mostly on roads near Rt 80 around Garrett Mountain for this hike (we'll follow the above route on trail on the next series hike).


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-0/p206x206/270425_10150254292781777_2853229_n.jpg?oh=f8b85ad10169b4e0702c32d8f638d0f9&oe=57827EC3

This will likely be among the longer of the Morris Canal hikes, perhaps as much as 18 miles, but mostly rather easy. There are bus stops and such along the way should anyone need to cut out a bit early.
Some of this offers rare opportunities to see the remains of the Morris Canal not often seen. For more information, contact me at[masked]

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This is one of our most breathtaking hikes!  Challenge your sense of adventure as you work your way to the top of the Spring Farm Trail Head as the hustle and bustle of the city gives way to quiet, forested paths and 360 degree views of the valley and the famous Gunks Mountain range near New Paltz, NY. Enjoy an invigorating day out of the city with other fun members of our group as you will be treated to some of the most spectacular views of the Hudson Valley.

$65 includes:  round trip transportation from train station to all attractions, hiking, all hiking fees, taxes and tips. You can also opt to drive to meet the group in Poughkeepsie.

*** MUST PRE-PAY TO RESERVE YOUR SPOT FOR THIS AMAZING EVENT! CLICK BELOW ***  

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mohonk-preserve-hike-intro-to-rock-scramble-wineries-lunch-tickets-25099107105

What is not included: since not all will be drinking, winery tasting fee's (usually $5-$8per person), lunch. Train.

What to bring: Hiking shoes or sneakers with hard soles and good treads, sunblock, bottled water, bag lunch.

What to expect: 7-13 fun and friendly people who love the outdoors.

Hiking level: The hike is fairly easy with some forest paths and carriage roads (level5)  The rock scramble would be a 6 out of 10 difficulty for a rock scramble. Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Paul.

results.description:
As parents, we want to see our children be healthy, happy, balanced and successful.
In a society where our children are expected to be 'well rounded,' the pressure is on on many different levels, in school, competitive sports, music lessons, volunteer activities, attention seeking friends, the need to fit in and self-esteem issues. The list could go on depending on the individual child and their individual circumstances. 

As adults, we may not think of these influences as stressful things for our kids, but in reality, they are very serious in the eyes of our youth. The events, real or perceived, that accompany our children in their lives have a profound effect on how they focus, feel and will eventuality have a huge impact on their overall future as they journey down the path to adulthood.

Yoga can help alleviate some of these stressors in your child's life, it can:
Reduce Stress
Improves Self-Esteem and Self-Confidence
Encourage cooperation
Improve Overall Health (Physically, it enhances their flexibility, strength, coordination, and body awareness)
Focus
Fatigue
Help Sleep Conditions
These are just a few areas where we can see a noticeable difference in the lives of our children.

Join us on Sunday mornings to begin a journey to a balanced, healthy life.

Parents are welcome to join us during this class.

results.description:
Caves in NY are finally reopened for the season so let's go underground and explore Clarksville cave located just southwest of Albany, NY.  This will be an introductory caving trip to orient new cavers and will also serve as a prerequisite for any future cave trips that I host to different locations.

Clarksville cave offers a good variety of larger beginner passages as well as some optional more advanced challenges and tight passageways for the thrill seekers in the group.  I expect a full tour of the cave could take approx 4-5 hours.

Feel free to show up early and take advantage of the great Breakfast served at the Jake Moon Restaurant just in front of the cave parking lot. As a courtesy to restaurant patrons it is asked that cavers use the rear parking lots designated for caving.  It is also requested that cavers don't enter the restaurant in there caving gear and that only paying customers use the bathrooms in the restaurant.  Thanks in advance for your cooperation.  Good relations with our neighbors will insure continued access to this cave for years to come!

Please Note:  Flash Flood Warnings may cancel this event!

REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum group size is 3; maximum group size is 15.

All cavers are expected to abide by the normally accepted rules of safe and conservation minded caving as outlined by the National Speleological Society, 2813 Cave Avenue, Huntsville, Alabama 35810-4431.

Clarksville Cave must be treated as a unique natural resource, and nothing should be taken out of the cave except trash.


MANDATORY GEAR:

Helmet with a chin strap (a bicycle helmet can work if you don't have a climbing helmet)

Three (3) sources of light, one of which must be helmet mounted

Knee pads (from a sporting goods or hardware store is OK)  If you can find something that covers your shin & knee that would be even better!

NO COTTON CLOTHING! Wear something you don't mind getting ruined that will keep you warm even when wet. (If you tend to get really cold you might consider a farmer john style wetsuit under your coveralls - you might overheat though in the dry passages.)  You can expect to get wet at least up to your knees and possibly up to your neck if you choose to do the sump passage!  Expect this cave to be about 48-55 degrees F.  (Cotton coveralls are ok as long as you have a synthetic layer against your skin)

Footwear with good grip and ankle support that you don't mind getting soaked and muddy

A Clean Change of clothes for when you get out! Also bring a garbage bag or plastic bin for your wet muddy gear after the trip and be sure to launder any cave gear before re-entering another cave to prevent any possible cross-contamination that could effect the bat population


OTHER RECOMMENDED GEAR:

Neoprene Socks - feet are usually the first part of the body to get wet and cold

Gloves (cheap gardening gloves with the rubber coated palms work well) If you tend to get really cold you might consider neoprene gloves that will keep you warm when wet.

Coveralls with synthetic undergarments worn underneath works best for protection, warmth and maneuverability

Elbow pads

A small pack for basic supplies like water, snacks, extra batteries, first aid, duct tape, etc.


CAVING GEAR SAMPLE IMAGE:

(only used for example - Vertical gear not needed on this trip - be sure you at least have the items listed above under Mandatory Gear)

**Click here for a detailed Map of the cave**

Clarksville and many other caves in the Northeastern Region of the US are owned / managed by the NCC (Northeastern Cave Conservancy).

The Northeastern Cave Conservancy, Inc. (NCC) is a not-for-profit corporation committed to the conservation, study, management, and acquisition of caves and karst areas having significant geological, hydrological, biological, recreational, historical or aesthetic features. 

To find out more about the NCC and its other great cave preserves please visit them at 

http://www.necaveconservancy.org

results.description:
Weir Farm National Historic Site

http://www.nps.gov/wefa/index.htm

Давайте познакомимся с работами Julian Alden Weir, Американского художика импрессиониста конца 19 начала 20 веков

Дом - Музей художника находится недалеко  от NYC в Fairfield County

http://www.the-athenaeum.org/art/list.php?m=a&s=tu&aid=546

------------------------------------------------------------------

Julian Alden Weir (August 30, 1852 – December 8, 1919) was an American impressionist painter and member of the Cos Cob Art Colony near Greenwich, Connecticut. Weir was also one of the founding members of "The Ten", a loosely allied group of American artists dissatisfied with professional art organizations, who banded together in 1898 to exhibit their works as a stylistically unified group

Weir painted impressionist landscapes and figurative works, many of which centered on his Connecticut farms at Branchville and Windham. His style varied from traditional, vibrant impressionism to a more subdued and shadowy tonalism. He also became skilled at etching

----------------------------------------

Fees

Access to the parking lot, grounds, special programs, Burlingham House Visitor Center, Weir Studio, Young Studio, and ranger-guided tours of the Weir House are all provided free of charge by the National Park Service.

----------------------------------------

Directions

http://www.nps.gov/wefa/planyourvisit/directions.htm

735 Nod Hill Rd, Wilton, CT 06897

results.description:
Hi there! I started this group last year, and I want to keep it going, as sharing meditation with others is my passion. We'll meet Saturdays and Sundays at 10am under the big shady tree at the Great Hill in Central park (the entrance is Central Park west and 103rd street). Take the path leading into central park, and go left (up the slope) until you get to the clearing at the top of the hill. If it's rainy or bad weather, I won't be there, but if the suns out, you can find me under the hill. I will let the group know ahead of time if I have to cancel in advance. The session starts 10am, running till around 10:45 or 11am. Bring a towel to sit on, and some water to drink. Beginners and experienced meditators welcome. I try to incorporate a range of styles, as different methods suit different people. I practice vipassana (the practice of calm abiding and observing) and qigong (the art of moving the body's energy), which mold quite well together. Look forward to seeing all of you!

This meditation is free. A $5-10 donation is suggested, but not at all necessary.
results.how_to_find_us: At Central Park West and 103rd Street, take the path into Central Park.  Immiditately after entering, turn left and take the stairs up the path leading upwards.  After reaching the clearing at the top of the hill, find us under the big shady tree

Transportation Alternatives' Bronx and Queens Committees are teaming up to do a joint ride! Let's join them to learn more about the complete streets efforts of their volunteer committees and get a chance to explore the new Bronx/Queens bike/pedestrian connector between the Bronx and Randall’s Island.


The ride starts at the NE corner of E. Moshulu Pkwy South and Jerome Ave at the 4 train subway stop, heads down to Queens via Randall's Island, takes a there-and-back-again tour of the new Queens Blvd bike lane to end at the Long Island City Flea Market, where you can explore the culinary delights of 20-some-odd food vendors in the marketplace (http://licflea.com/)

The ride is about 18 miles at a relaxed pace.


RSVP at https://www.facebook.com/events/248536432165925/

Directions: Take the 4 train to Mosholu Pkwy station in the Bronx. From the station go south on Jerome Ave to East Mosholu Pkwy South. The group will be meeting at the northeast corner of the intersection.

Bring a lock so you can park your bike at the flea market at the end of the ride!

For more information visit https://www.transalt.org/calendar/9591

results.description:
In collaboration with Bronx Climate Justice North, Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture will join the rally for Farmworker Justice at St. Stephen's United Methodist Church (146 W. 228th in Marble Hill from 12-12:45 PM) on Sunday, May 22.

A lot of us are unaware that New York State farmworkers are excluded from the labor rights and protections that other workers receive. For example, they receive no overtime, are not guaranteed a day of rest, have no right to bargain collectively or create a union. They have had to fight for drinking water and sanitation stations in the fields. There is a bill - the Farmworker Fair Labor Protection Act (S 1291/A 4762) that Senate Republicans in Albany are refusing to allow to come to the floor for a vote. Governor Cuomo has said he will sign the bill if it comes to his desk. The struggle for rights for New York's farmworkers has gone on for decades. It's time for it to end. 

The March for Farmworker Justice will take place from May 15 - June 1, from Smithtown on Long Island to Albany, with rallies and events along the march route. Come out and march with us on Sunday, May 22 (see below)! 

Additional Ways to Get Involved in the March for Farmworker Justice:

Service Before the March: On Sunday, May 22, meet us at 9:30am at Holyrood Episcopal Church (715 W. 179th St between Broadway and Ft. Washington Ave) for a morning church service. It will be led by Rev. Richard Witt from Rural and MIgrant Ministries, a long-time leader in the struggle for justice for New York's farmworkers. 

Join the March: If you would also like to join the march on the morning of May 22, we will start marching at 10:30 AM at Holyrood Episcopal Church (715 W. 179th St between Broadway and Ft. Washington Ave) and march until we reach St. Stephens in Marble Hill around 12 PM. A rally will take place there until about 1 PM.

Assemble bagged lunches: Adults and children are invited to the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture on Saturday, May 21 at 2 PM. We will assemble 100 bagged lunches for the marchers. Children will learn about the March for Farmworker Justice and create notes for the marchers which we will put in the lunches. For more information: http://www.rysec.org/event/lunch-farmworker-march

Host a Marcher: The March organizers are looking for hosts for about 10 marchers who need housing for the night of Saturday, May 21. If you are interested, please email [masked]. 

Donate: If you would like to donate money for Marchers' bagged lunches and other supplies, please email [masked]. 

For more information on the March for Farmworker Justice, visit <a>http://ruralmigrantministry.org/farmworker-march</a>; 

Please Note: This event will be in place of our regular Sunday Platform.
results.how_to_find_us: Visit www.rysec.org/directions
results.name: Join us at the March for Farmworker Justice!

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed! 

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

results.description:
One of my favorite places to stroll since I was a young woman is at the water's edge in Sheepshead Bay.  I used to love watching the fishing boats come in early in the morning, fresh with their catch of the eve.  I'd cross the bridge and hike out to Manhattan Beach and back again.  Just as often I'd be out there on my bicycle.

We'll walk along Emmons Avenue to West End Avenue, then head to Oriental Boulevard toward Manhattan Beach and Kingsborough College.  From there we'll walk back toward the foot bridge along Shore Boulevard and cross back to Emmons Avenue.

We'll walk at a  moderate pace for approximately 2-2.5 hours.  For those who return to the starting point, you will have walked approximately 5 miles total.   You can drop off anywhere before the end point, if you want.

Around 1:15-1:30, we should arrive in time for lunch at Opera Cafe, for anyone who's interested.  http://www.operacafelounge.com/


Rain or heavy winds cancel the walk.

I will wait only 10 minutes for latecomers.  Please arrive on time.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll wait at the SW corner of Emmons and Knapp
results.name: A walk in Sheepshead Bay and lunch at Opera Cafe afterwards

results.description:
Did you know that at one time, you could order an entire building facade from a catalog?

In 1850, James Bogardus, a New York inventor and architect, filed a patent for using cast-iron in the construction of building facades. 

Cast iron could be cast into a wide array of shapes and designs, allowing elaborate facades that were far cheaper than traditional stone carved ones. 

Over the next 30-plus years, in cities across the country, merchants and factory owners built thousands of cast-iron buildings, most of which are now long gone.

But in New York City, we have in the SoHo-Cast Iron Historic District a collection of well-preserved and photogenic cast-iron structures, unrivaled in the world. 

We'll meetup at Petrosino Square, which is a small park bounded by Lafayette, Cleveland, Spring, and Kenmare Streets. The Spring Street No. 6 subway station is just east of the northern tip of Petrosino Square.

venue.name: In front of the National Academy Museum, 5th Avenue and 89th Street

results.description:
About 7 miles and 5 hours. We tried this once on a very windy day; we'll try it again and hope for mild weather. We will visit two museums connected to Archer Huntington and see statues created by his wife, Anna Hyatt Huntington.

We will meet in front of the National Academy Museum at 11:00, spend about 30 minutes in the museum, walk across Central Park to the Whole Foods at Columbus Avenue and 97th Street for lunch, walk west along 93rd Street to Riverside Drive to see the Joan of Arc statue, then north along Riverside Drive to the Hispanic Society museum at Broadway and 155th Street. The Hispanic Society museum is open until 4:30 p.m.

The American Academy of Arts and Letters, which is next door to the Hispanic Society in the Audubon Terrace complex, is also showing an exhibit of works by newly inducted members. This exhibit is open until 4:00 p.m. 

There will be a somewhat steep staircase to walk up in Riverside Park and another hill to walk up at 155th Street. Admission to the National Academy is pay what you wish but you must pay something, I paid $1.00; the Hispanic Society and American Academy exhibit are free.


Archer Huntington was the son (step or perhaps biological) of railroad magnate Collis P. Huntington and his second wife, Arrabella Yarrington, who was the teen aged daughter of the proprietor of a boarding house where Collis stayed while developing railroads in Virginia. Arrabella used her husbands wealth to accumulate a large art collection, which is now housed at the Huntington Library in San Marino, California, and encouraged her son Archer to pursue intellectual and artistic activities.

The National Academy is an honorary association of American artists which operates a school and museum and is housed in the opulent townhouse that was Archer and Anna's home and Anna's sculpture studio. The academy is closing the museum on June 1 to sell the building to create an endowment and move to a new location. Archer established the Hispanic Society in 1904 as part of his lifelong interest in the history and culture of Spain. Archer and Anna met when he commissioned her to create a sculpture of El Cid for the courtyard of the Hispanic Society.

Here is a link to the National Academy museum: National Academy Museum

Here is a link to the Hispanic Society web site: Hispanic Society

Meet: 11:00 in front of the National Academy museum at 1083 Fifth Avenue, at 89th Street. Take the 4,5,6 train to 86th Street and Lexington Avenue.

Leader: Tom Bergen[masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the $20 annual membership fee, $3 for non-members. Non-members please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike or visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: Huntington Walk: National Academy, Joan of Arc and Hispanic Society

results.description: The Sunday School at the Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County helps children aged 2-14 explore and develop their moral and critical thinking skills through fun and interactive lessons and field trips. We meet weekly at 11am on Sundays for 1.5 hours while the adults of the Ethical Culture Society are attending the platform meeting. Our wide ranging curriculum allows kids to examine themselves, their community and the world in general. We teach about different cultures, philosophies and religions. We encourage our students to ask questions, think for themselves and make up their own minds about the bigger questions in life. Our children develop strong values and ethical standpoints. The Sunday School Graduation Rite of Passage, completed by our 8th graders, allows them to present to the community how their Sunday School experience has informed their moral and ethical development.

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - There's No "I" in Ensemble

This Improve with Improv workshop will focus on working as an ensemble. Whether you're playing a principal role, a supportive role, or even if you're off stage, you are still part of a team and have a role to play.

You will engage in group exercises, games and scenes that train the performer to give and take the spotlight, to stay engaged and involved in what is going on on stage, and to work as a team.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

Suggested Donation: $15 (most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 per session or more)


THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV

Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.

Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.
results.name: There's No "I" in Ensemble

If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host: [masked]

Experience Central Park in a whole new way with our Central Park Scavenger Hunt!  It is a fun way to meet new people or hang out with familiar friends in NYC's Urban Oasis! If you don't have a team we will set you up on one as you set out to find fun and historical things that are already part of the park.  Following the hunt you can join members of the hunt for a bite to eat at a local pub or restaurant.

How it works:

-Come alone or with friends to The Firehouse Tavern at 11am.  We will set up the teams (teams of 5 only)

-Each team will have 90 minutes to find as many clues at they can inside the park (clues will be in historical markers, wildlife, street performers, tourists, fountains, statues, bridges and hidden secrets)

-At the end of the 90 minutes each team will return to The Firehouse Tavern to see which group has uncovered the most clues to win prizes!

venue.name: Cadman Plaza (Turf Fields)

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 9:45AM (2 hours before the start time)


• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.


Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.
results.name: PICK UP GAME 90 mins SUN 11:45 AM Cadman Plaza

group.name: Brooklyn Soccer Club - Adult Soccer lessons and pickup games

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed! 

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.
results.name: Soccer Sunday -@west 108th Street Field - 11:45am

EVENT TYPE: Festival

DESCRIPTION:

Hello!    Ni-Hao!    Jia-Ba-vue?

Welcome to the 15th Annual Passport to Taiwan Festival, the celebration of Taiwanese American Heritage Week in New York City! This year’s festival is set on May 22nd at Union Square North from 12PM to 5PM, be sure to mark your calendar now and invite your friends and family to join us for a day of festivities.

Items below are updated as soon as they are finalized! It’s going to another fantastic year at Union Square Park!

FOOD:


Delicacies Intestine Vermicelli 大腸麵線
Sausage 烤香腸
Steamed Rice Cake 碗稞
Lobaben (Minced Pork over Rice) 滷肉飯
Stir Fry Rice Vermicelli 炒米粉
Bamboo Tamale 肉粽
Oden (Fish Cake) 黑輪
Blood Pudding 豬血糕
Oyster Pancake 蚵仔煎
Shaved Ice 剉冰
Ice Cream Wrap 潤餅冰淇淋
Aiyu Jelly 愛玉
Happy Lemon, Chi Ken. TKettle, CBao, A-Pou’s Taste Cart

More to come!


Arts & Crafts


Aboriginal Crafts
Hakka Crafts
Craft Masters from Taiwan
More to come!


REFERENCE LINKS:

http://p2tw.org/
results.name: Passport to Taiwan 2016

results.description:
The Antonines were four Roman Emperors who ruled between 138 and 192: Antoninus Pius, Lucius Verus, Marcus Aurelius and Commodus.
Referring to the rule of Nerva, Trajan, Hadrian, Antoninus Pius and Marcus Aurelius, Machiavelli wrote, “From the study of this history we may also learn how a good government is to be established”. He theorized that the success of these five emperors who ascended the throne by adoption repudiated the merits of dynastic inheritance – “But as soon as the empire fell once more to the heirs by birth, its ruin recommenced.”
Machiavelli also noted that these adopted emperors, through good rule, earned the respect of those around them, saying, “Titus, Nerva, Trajan, Hadrian, Antoninus, and Marcus had no need of praetorian cohorts, or of countless legions to guard them, but were defended by their own good lives, the good-will of their subjects, and the attachment of the senate.”
We'll also cover the popular philosophies of the period and their impact on Rome.

If RSVPs are closed, please indicate if you want a spot.
results.name: Antonine Dynasty: More Good Emperors

results.description:
Join us in seeing this new hit Broadway musical comedy! It's about the love you find right under your nose. 

Meet up to 50 Meetup members from multiple groups at our Pre-Mingle & sit together at the show. 

This is your chance to make some new friends and see a fantastic show. Our dedicated host will be on hand to make introductions at pre-mingle. 

*Must purchase ticket in advance. No tickets sold at door. 

*Get Tickets HERE

We will meet for the pre-mingle (NOON) at a local bar/pub near the theater, where we will hand out the show tickets.  The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to purchase ticket, week of show date.  

We'll leave the pre-mingle at 1:30 so we have enough time to settle into our seats for the 2pm show. The group will be sitting together in the rear Mezz.

Food and drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $79.50 to $89.50 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket) 

*Get your tickets ASAP HERE

*Prepay Only Event. RSVP doesn't hold your spot. Must buy ticket to attend. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZkHEXWs_Pqo

About the Show

She Loves Me follows Amalia and Georg, two parfumerie clerks who aren’t quite the best of friends. Constantly bumping heads while on the job, the sparring coworkers can’t seem to find common ground. But little do they know the anonymous pen pals they have both been falling for happen to be each other! Will love continue to blossom once their identities are finally revealed?

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/shelovesme/dates/May-22-2016_at_1200PM
results.name: Broadway's New Hit Musical 'She Loves Me' & Pre-Mingle (Prepay Required)

Spring has sprung! That means rainy weather, longer days and tax refunds feeding the dreaded Gear Acquisition Syndrome!! The temptation to go out and buy extremely expensive lighting gear is strong, but is it necessary? That's what we're going to find out. 

For the next workshop at Adorama, we will be going through the steps to create a beautiful portrait. We'll be using studio strobes and top of the line light modifiers to get a high quality shot. And the twist (because there's always a twist): we going to attempt to recreate the shot using less expensive modifiers and speed lights (flashes, flash guns or hot shoe flashes). In addition to recreating a studio shot with speed lights, we'll also go over all the steps necessary to create the portrait including creating a concept, deciding the type of lighting to use, hair style and make up that would compliment the shot. 

Okay, okay . . . . there's another Adorama Gift Certificate that will be looking for a new home in someone's pocket. At the end of the workshop, we'll hand out a sign-in sheet and provide details on how to make the gift certificate yours. 

NOTE: Your camera and/or notepads are not needed for this workshop. Adorama will likely be recording the event and we will distribute the video when available. Brooklyn Born will also be writing a blog post on the steps that will be taken during the workshop.  We want you to leave anything that can be a distraction at home so your full attention is ours. Anything that was said can be viewed later when the recording is distributed. 

******************** 


Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup charges organizers a semi-annual fee to maintain the group's event pages.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at https://www.paypal.me/nycphotographers.  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

results.description:
Captain Lawrence Brewery turns 10 this year! Let's celebrate by skipping the official party, and going a week later when we can go back to getting toasted on 5 oz. sample beers for about $10.

There's limited parking in the back, through the gate to the brewery (signs will tell you where to go), and some street parking around back, I believe. Sample glasses are $2 (or bring yours if you have one) and chips to cash in for beer are $5 for 5, or $10 for 12.

Tours of the brewery are also available if you're interested. You can sign up on the website, captainlawrencebrewing.com.

Grab your designated driver, and let's ring in the summer with some afternoon drinking!

results.description:
Hello Everyone!


This is an open house and introduction to Brooklyn Meditation. This introduction gives hope for those seeking happiness, peace, and truth.

Brooklyn Meditation is a comfortable place to come and rest your mind.  The purpose of our meet up is to share, and get to know new people.  There is a brief meditation taking place at the meet up, however, this is more of a chance to talk about what we are each seeking through meditation.


The journey from the mind to the heart, is not very far :)  Let's live the highest quality of life!!!

**If you are not able to attend this event, but have an interest in Brooklyn Meditation you can call our center to have a personal introduction.


We are located at 833 Union St., Fl 2, Park Slope, Brooklyn.

[masked]

***Parking may be hard to find considering it's only street parking available. If you need to, allow some time to find parking. Sorry about any inconvenience!! ***

results.description:
Updated 5/16/16

SPRING/SUMMER SCHEDULE

• Saturday @10am - Morningside Park

• Sunday @12pm - Morningside Park

• Tuesday/Thursday @5pm - Riverside Park


Hello!

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

It's important to RSVP so that you can get updates through the Meetup app. Also PLEASE bring a dark shirt and a light shirt so that it helps distinguish teams.

See you soon!

Damien 

[masked]
[masked]
@ProfDuchamp

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">
results.why: It's fun and you like it...

results.description:
You asked for more....so Vonnegut it is.

Mr. Vonnegut gave himself an "A" ranking this book, so at least we know it came out as he intended.  

"Jailbird takes us into a fractured and comic, pure Vonnegut world of high crimes and misdemeanors in government—and in the heart. This wry tale follows bumbling bureaucrat Walter F. Starbuck from Harvard to the Nixon White House to the penitentiary as Watergate’s least known co-conspirator. But the humor turns dark when Vonnegut shines his spotlight on the cold hearts and calculated greed of the mighty, giving a razor-sharp edge to an unforgettable portrait of power and politics in our times." - Amazon

 ____________________________ 

** NOTE : I WILL BE EMAILING MEMBERS ASKING YOU TO CONFIRM YOUR "YES" RSVP A FEW DAYS BEFORE THE MEETUP, WITH YOUR REPLY DUE NO LATER THAN APPROXIMATELY 24 HOURS BEFORE THE EVENT SO WE CAN GET A PRETTY ACCURATE HEADCOUNT. PLEASE REMEMBER TO CHANGE A "YES" RSVP TO A "NO" IF YOUR PLANS CHANGE, SO MEMBERS ON THE WAITING LIST HAVE A CHANCE TO READ THE BOOK. AND REMEMBER TO SEE THE "PAGES" LINK FOR THE NO-SHOW POLICY, IT'S STRICTLY ENFORCED. THANKS

results.description:
In honor of Jewish American Heritage Month, May's book is

Time's Arrow Or, The Nature of the Offense By Martin Amis </a>

From Amazon:"In Time's Arrow the doctor Tod T. Friendly dies and then feels markedly better, breaks up with his lovers as a prelude to seducing them, and mangles his patients before he sends them home. And all the while Tod's life races backward toward the one appalling moment in modern history when such reversals make sense."

Schedule

Noon: Brunch at <a href="http://clintonhallny.com/">Clinton Hall - Brunch Menu

2:30 pm: Leave for the Museum of Jewish Heritage (10 minute walk)

3:00 pm Attend - Book Launch - Rhapsody in Schmaltz by Michael Wex

I have secured 10 tickets for the 3:00 pm program and the first 10 confirmed RSVPs will be able to use those tickets. The remaining RSVPs will need to reserve their free tickets here. 

***PLEASE NOTE THE FOLLOWING***

~As an inaugural brunch discussion event, I have waived the standard $2 fee so THERE IS NO FEE for this event. However, you are responsible for your brunch tab + 20% tip. Additionally, you must pay for your own General Museum Admission. Ticket prices as follows:  

$12 Adults

$10 Seniors 65 and up 


$7 Students
Free for children ages 12 and under and MEMBERS

~RSVPs will be open until midnight the day before the event. I will also send out my cell number to those attending.


Looking forward to seeing you there!

~Hazel

results.description:
Whit Stillman's new film, Love and Friendship, is an adaptation of a Jane Austen novella that has gotten great pre-release reviews.

Vulture says:
"The elaborately formal period comedy of manners Love & Friendship has a different vibe than other movies of its ilk. The delight of its director, Whit Stillman, enlivens every scene, so what might have seemed stilted is full of human faces in exquisitely subtle states of panic...He serves up this late-18th-century world with theatrical bravura...he creates Wildean texture." 
The Guardian says:
"Whit Stillman, expert chronicler of privileged youth, adapts the Jane Austen novella Lady Susan for his first period film, Love & Friendship. The material is a perfect fit for the film-maker behind the elegant comedies Metropolitan, Barcelona and most recently, Damsels in Distress...Kate Beckinsale, who he previously directed in The Last Days of Disco, effortlessly leads the film as Lady Susan Vernon, a beautiful and conniving widow: her sister-in-law, Mrs Catherine Vernon (Emma Greenwall), refers to her as a “genius of the evil kind” and “a serpent in Eden’s garden”.

The full Vulture and Guardian reviews are here:
http://www.theguardian.com/film/2016/jan/24/love-friendship-review-kate-beckinsale-devious-delight-sundance

http://www.vulture.com/2016/05/movie-review-love-friendship.html
results.name: Let's Watch "Love and Friendship" and Chat Together Afterwards Over Coffee

results.description:
It seems that Count Dracula (Bela Lugosi), in league with a beautiful but diabolical lady scientist (Lenore Aubert), needs a "simple, pliable" brain with which to reactivate Frankenstein's creature (Glenn Strange). The "ideal" brain belongs to the hapless Lou Costello, whom the lady doctor woos to gain his confidence and lure him to the operating table. Lawrence Talbot (Lon Chaney Jr.), better known as the Wolf Man, arrives on the scene to warn Costello and his pal Bud Abbott of Dracula's nefarious schemes. Throughout the film, the timorous Costello witnesses the nocturnal rituals of Dracula and the Monster, but can't convince the ever-doubting Abbott--until the wild climax in Dracula's castle, where the comedians are pursued by all three of the film's monstrosities. As a bonus, the Invisible Man (voiced by an unbilled Vincent Price) shows up for "all the excitement."

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j6l8auIACyc

results.description:
Please join us for Loving Messages with the Blessed Mother channeled through Angelo Rusciano, followed by an afternoon High Tea.

• Group Inspired Messages from the Blessed Mother Mary - 1 hour


• Individual Questions and Answers with the Blessed Mother - 1 hour


• Followed by High tea with Artisan Teas and Desserts, Mingling, Sharing and   Book Signing -  1 hour


We will experience Mother Mary in a manner yet to be revealed by another. She, the voice of a beloved spirit, through her own life experience, has transformed herself into a messenger who's most cherished desire is to empower us all with a collective truth -To Love and accept ourselves and those around us. 

"Mother Mary Now" is a refreshing and transformative dialogue delivered by Angelo Rusciano.

Angelo will have his book, Sacred Feminine - Intersessions with the Divine Mother, available for purchase and signing.
