results.description:
Eric Asimov, wine critic for The New York Times, has been running a monthly wine "school" column for the newspaper's readers. He selects a region, does a little write-up, and identifies three wines to try. After drinking the wines, people go to the newspaper's on-line comments section to have a conversation about what they've learned and liked. I've had fun doing this for several months, but thought it might be even better with some of you. Let's meet together from time to time, to drink and talk!

The point of this group is to teach and learn from each other.  All levels are welcome, though we do want participation in tasting and discussing the wines from all.  We keep the group small so we can focus on the wines!  Good behavior is a must, as we will be meeting in a private residence.


MAY details:  We'll be drinking Barbera from the Alba and Asti regions.  Click here to see Asimov's article with a list of the assigned wines. Please indicate in the comments section or by emailing me which wine you plan to bring.  This helps us have a variety of bottles.


What to bring: Each participant will be expected to read Asimov's monthly wine write-up and bring one bottle of wine recommended in the article. He generally identifies three specific bottles, and also lists alternates if the three are not available. I find snooth.com and wine-searcher.com helpful in figuring out which wine shops might have the bottle you are looking for.   Please make every effort to find the specific bottles listed by Asimov. Be sure to post a comment with which wine you will be bringing so that we can have a variety of bottles. Some bottle duplication is fine when our group is large, but we don't want all the same bottle. 

Because wine needs food, each participant should also bring something tasty to eat and share. 

RSVP and Waitlist:  If the Meetup is full, you will be offered the option of placing your name on a Waitlist.  Be aware that the Meetup platform will automatically change your RSVP from "Waitlist" and "Yes" if a spot opens. The expectation is that you will monitor your status on the Waitlist, and remove your name if you no longer want to attend.  

Cost:  The cost of the Asimov Wine School meetups will vary depending on the cost of that month's wine.  Generally it's been somewhere between $15-$70 for the bottle you bring plus the cost of whatever snack you select to share.
results.name: Barbera of Alba and Asti

Saludos Writers, 

We enjoyed an intimate first Writers Group. And we got down to the business of writing with a short exercise to get our ideas on paper. This was followed by constructive critique that supported rich ideas and offered suggestions on strengthening the work.

Unfortunately todays Inwood/Northern Manhattan Writers Group needs to be rescheduled. Our venue, Inwood Local, is becoming a very busy place as the Spring/Summer crowd picks up. As Brannon stated, the crowd and noise works against our need to talk, think, write, critique and create. 

We are reaching out to other local venues meanwhile. Keep writing and we will be back next week - Memorial Day weekend I know. Please let us know if you can make a Saturday meeting versus Sunday. We are building a community of writers so your input is valued.

Glorya

So, if you're new to Reiki this is a great chance to try it! 

Everyone will receive group-style Reiki where one person at a time will lie on the table while the others give Reiki.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

So after asking around it appears there is plenty enough interest in a bus trip so I have gone ahead and taken care of everything.

I secured us tickets in the low rows of Section 125, so we did quite well. If we need additional tickets later and you buy late your section may change, but for now we'll all be there.

Bus will leave Bar 43 in Sunnyside, Queens at 5:30pm and pick up at McHale's Bar in the city at 6pm, giving us plenty of time to make it to the arena comfortably.

Cost is $85 and that includes roundtrip bus, beer on the bus and your ticket to the show. They charged me fees on every individual ticket so I couldn't keep it at $80, but still a great price for the trip!

Tickets can be bought and more information is available here: 

http://www.footballfactoryny.com/trip/bus-trip-to-wwe-extreme-rules-522/

Please spread the word, this is an open event so you may bring friends etc. Hopefully we can all meet early at the bar and pre-game so we're all in great form by the time we get there!

Any questions please feel free to let me know here. Thanks and I'll look forward to seeing you all on May 22.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Discussion Questions:

1. Early on it is clear that Addie has a rebellious streak, joining the library group and running away to Rockport Lodge. Is Addie right to disobey her parents? Where does she get her courage?

2. Addie’s mother refuses to see Celia’s death as anything but an accident, and Addie comments that "whenever I heard my mother’s version of what happened, I felt sick to my stomach" (page 94). Did Celia commit suicide? How might the guilt that Addie feels differ from the guilt her mother feels?

3. When Addie tries on pants for the first time, she feels emotionally as well as physically liberated, and confesses that she would like to go to college (page 108). How does the social significance of clothing and hairstyle differ for Addie, Gussie, and Filomena in the book?

4. Diamant fills her narrative with a number of historical events and figures, from the psychological effects of World War I and the pandemic outbreak of influenza in 1918 to child labor laws to the cultural impact of Betty Friedan. How do real-life people and events affect how we read Addie’s fictional story?

5. Gussie is one of the most forward-thinking characters in the novel; however, despite her law degree she has trouble finding a job as an attorney because "no one would hire a lady lawyer" (page 145). What other limitations do Addie and her friends face in the work force? What limitations do women and/or minorities face today?

6. After distancing herself from Ernie when he suffers a nervous episode brought on by combat stress, Addie sees a community of war veterans come forward to assist him (page 155). What does the remorse that Addie later feels suggest about the challenges American soldiers face as they reintegrate into society? Do you think soldiers today face similar challenges?

7. Addie notices that the Rockport locals seem related to one another, and the cook Mrs. Morse confides in her sister that, although she is usually suspicious of immigrant boarders, "some of them are nicer than Americans" (page 167). How does tolerance of the immigrant population vary between city and town in the novel? For whom might Mrs. Morse reserve the term "Americans"?

8. Addie is initially drawn to Tessa Thorndike because she is a Boston Brahmin who isn’t afraid to poke fun at her own class on the women’s page of the newspaper. What strengths and weaknesses does Tessa’s character represent for educated women of the time? How does Addie’s description of Tessa bring her reliability into question?

9. Addie’s parents frequently admonish her for being ungrateful, but Addie feels she has earned her freedom to move into a boarding house when her parents move to Roxbury, in part because she contributed to the family income (page 185). How does the Baum family move to Roxbury show the ways Betty and Addie think differently than their parents about household roles? Why does their father take such offense at Harold Levine’s offer to house the family?

10. The last meaningful conversation between Addie and her mother turns out to be an apology her mother meant for Celia, and for a moment during her mother’s funeral Addie thinks, "She won’t be able to make me feel like there’s something wrong with me anymore" (page 276). Does Addie find any closure from her mother’s death?

11. Filomena draws a distinction between love and marriage when she spends time catching up with Addie before her wedding, but Addie disagrees with the assertion that "you only get one great love in a lifetime" (page 289). In what ways do the different romantic experiences of each woman inform the ideas each has about love?

12. Filomena and Addie share a deep friendship. Addie tells Ada that "sometimes friends grow apart…But sometimes, it doesn’t matter how far apart you live or how little you talk—it’s still there" (page 283). What qualities do you think friends must share in order to have that kind of connection?

Karuna
Seichim Master Teacher

“All human beings are capable of emitting healing energy from the center of their palms. We can see by our auric field that our bodies are conduits of a vaster energy. We all know on some level that we can heal ourselves. After the initiations in Seichim, you will remember this in a whole new way. You will also see how you can infuse others with this healing energy*.
Seichim is a conscious, Universal, multi-spectrum energy. It is an ancient system of healing wisdom translated from Egyptian hieroglyphics into Sanskrit. Seichim, the word is used to designate both the energy itself and the healing system, which uses this conscious energy.
We are all born with a connection to these Universal energies. The initiations allow us to conduct, in a very conscious way, vast amounts of this power. The Seichim frequencies are powerful tools for growth and transformation. The energy can also be used in many healing modalities (the Quartz Crystal Bowls, copper devices, homeopathy, color therapy, etc.).
The ancient masters of Seichim revealed the existence of seven facets. Seichim Master Teachers are empowered to pass on all of these facets. Each facet is unique and complete within itself. The facets build on experience from preceding facets. Anyone becoming an initiate of any facet has complete, permanent empowerment of the unique attributes of that level. No further action or involvement with any organization is required.
Each initiation triggers healing, cleansing and balancing in the initiate. This is a powerful energy and individual exploration time varies. Once initiated, a practitioner’s life starts moving forward quickly. It becomes full of new experiences and opportunities to share and enjoy the energy in each of its unique aspects."
- The Seven Facets of Seichim by R. Neville Johnston and Mary Phelan

results.description:
Experiencing a love connection can bring tremendous joy in a healthy relationship. However, when love does not work, it can be extremely painful. It can bring about feelings of being stuck, having low self-esteem, feeling depressed or even health issues.

Did you ever ask yourself--

Why can't I leave or let go of the relationship?

What makes me stay?

This support groups offers more than just talk. During our session, in addition to honest-open sharing, members will experience a series of fun and eye-opening activities where you’ll explore meditation, role playing, educational readings and structured exercises within a safe, confidential. and supportive environment.

Join us for a transformative experience while connecting with other members struggling with similar issues on a journey to creating fulfilling relationships, healing and/or letting go of unhealthy ones. Come share about the effects of unhealthy relationships in your life. We will also share about what a healthy relationship looks like and how we can begin to have a healthier relationship with ourselves.

Who can attend?

Anyone who is feeling stuck, empty, or frustrated in a relationship and is ready to work towards a happier future in life and love. We welcome people at all steps of their journey – whether you’ve been to a support group, meet-up, counseling or a newcomer!

What should I bring?

Desire to change and an open mind!

How much does it cost?

$10 per Session

This week's special-bring a friend get half off the next session 

This group is facilitated by a Certified Addiction Recovery Coach, Certified Addiction Peer Advocate, Life Skills Coach and Independent Health Coach. Debbie brings her personal experiences of navigating through and triumphing over the difficulties of toxic relationships.

Not able to make our monthly meeting, but want to learn more about our group or individual sessions? Reach out to our organizer, Debbie for more information at [masked].

results.name: When Love Does Not Work-Part Two

results.description:
Note: 

This event is in GERMAN LANGUAGE ONLY, and is best suited for people who at lease lived in Germany at one point, otherwise you may not be able to fully enjoy the references and humor.


Please register thru eventbrite here:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/radio-aktiv-1-mann-50-stimmen-1000-lieder-tickets-25332168197

Please donate $20 (suggested) upon entering the venue. No one will stop you if you don't, but that is still a bargain for the type of entertainment you will enjoy, so we kindly ask you to respect the artist by helping out. 

There will be a second chance to see this act on Tuesday, the 24th, please check our calendar.


The following description is in German since the entire event will be in German language:

André Hartmann aus München hat für das New Yorker Publikum das Beste aus seinem aktuellen Kabarettprogrammen zusammengestellt und kommt bereits zum vierten Mal in die Stadt. 

Als Wortakrobat und Tastengenie bringt er in dieser Bühnen-Musikshow seine beliebtesten 50 Promi-Stimmen auf die Bühne! In seinem neuen Musik-Comedy-Kabarett-Programm "Radio-AKTIV!" durchleuchtet er die vielen schönen, schrillen und schrecklichen Radiosender der Welt und kombiniert dabei als "Radiomoderator und DJ" unterschiedliche Lieder, die das Publikum ihm vorgibt, spontan so mit einander am Klavier, dass völlig einzigartige neue Songs entstehen.

Freuen Sie sich auf viele deutschsprachige Celebrities - von Udo Lindenberg bis Heino, von der atomaren Angie bis zum "Super-Gauck". Wortwitz auf hohem Niveau, preisgekröntes Klavierspiel und unfassbare Spontaneität vereinigen sich.

Dabei begleitet sich der "Strahlemann" selbst am Piano und zieht sämtliche Register des Klavierspiels, von Barock bis Rock.

Ein musikalischer Abend der besonderen Klasse!

Seit seinen Auftritten auf dem Nockherberg (Bayrisches Fernsehen, in den Jahren [masked]) ist André Hartmann als Politikerdouble einem großen Publikum in Deutschland bekannt. Das Programm „Radio-AKTIV“ hatte 2014 Premiere in der Münchner Lach- und Schießgesellschaft.

EINTRITT ist auf SPENDENBASIS ($20 suggested donation), aber RSVP ist erwünscht. 

How do I get there by train?

1: 28th Street - 1 block

N/R: 28th Street - 2-3 Blocks

B/D/F/M: 34th Street Herald Square - 4-6 Blocks

A/C/E: 34th Street Penn Station - 6 Blocks

Keep in mind that weekend schedules are in effect, not all trains will be running.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Hey ya'all. Yeah, I know. There ain't SHIT to fear from Fear the Walking Dead. It sucks pretty bad, but I'm still hoping beyond hope that it gets better. I just need SOMETHING to keep me going in the off-season when The Walking Dead is sleeping.

SO, we're gonna host the Season 2 Finale of Fear the Walking Dead (yuck), followed by the World Premiere of the new AMC original show, PREACHER. It's based on the American comic book series published by Vertigo, an imprint of DC Comics. The series was created by writer Garth Ennis and artist Steve Dillon with painted covers by Glenn Fabry. Hey, it can't be all that bad with one of the main characters being an Irish vampire...

Also, for the very first time, we're starting a free drink contest which we'll be doing at each of our Meetups from no on. Natalia and I will buy a drink (up to $10) for whomever can best act out the part of the short YouTube movie clip we include on the event description. For our first contest the scene is 'the Mussels from Brussels', none other than JCVD in the 1998 Martial Arts classic BLOODSPORT. If you haven't seen it yet then head to the nearest bridge and jump off.

https://youtu.be/0BJikt-htoY

We're co-hosting this with our friends from the NY Horror Movie MeatUP.

Preacher is the story of Jesse Custer (Dominic Cooper), a conflicted preacher in a small Texas town who is inhabited by a mysterious entity that allows him to develop a highly unconventional power. Jesse embarks on a journey to, literally, find God, joined by his ex-girlfriend Tulip (Ruth Negga) and an Irish vagabond named Cassidy (Joseph Gilgun).

www.AMC.com/shows/Preacher

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UNgI2sRzr8I
results.name: Season 2 Finale of Fear the Walking Dead (yuck!) & World Premiere of PREACHER!

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.

results.description:
REGISTER HERE

We are proud to present a panel discussion with four of the worlds leading female sports photojournalists. Elsa Garrison (Getty Sport), Maddie Meyer(Getty Sport), Ariele Goldman Hecht (Yankees) and Kathy Willens (AP) have covered virtually every type of major sports event, and they will share their experiences with us at Adorama's NYC Event Space. We will touch on subjects from how they broke into the business, their favorite athletes, what drives them and how to compete in a filed that's predominantly male. The panel will be moderated by Brad Smith, former Director of Photography at Sports Illustrated and Sports Desk editor atThe New York Times. Please join us!


Elsa Garrison is a Getty Images Sport staff photographer based in New York City. She started her career with Allsport in 1996 in Los Angeles, which was aquired by Getty in 1998. As a staff photographer she is responsible for a wide variety of assignmnts including such events as the World Series, NBA Finals, Stanley Cup Finals, World Cup Soccer, the Summer and Winter Olympic games, the Kentucky Derby, Belmont Stakes, among many others. Her work has been published on websites and magazines around the globe including the New York Times, Time Magazine, Sports illustrated, ESPN the Magazine, The Los Angeles Times, The Chicago Tribune, Boston Globe and more. Elsa is a graduate of the Missouri School of Journalism. 

Kathy Willens began her career covering night and weekend sporting events as a freelance photographer for several suburban Detroit newspapers. Hoping it would lead to a staff position, she took a job as a lab technician at the Miami News. She landed a staff job at the News after earning a string of front page pictures and feature stories shot on her own time. A year and a half of front pages later in 1976, Willens joined the Associated Press as one of their first female photographers. In 1993 she moved to AP’s New York headquarters where she remains, now celebrating her 40th year. 

Ariele Goldman Hecht has seen a lot through the lens of her camera in her 12 seasons with the New York Yankees. As the team’s only staff photographer, Hecht oversees all day-to-day photo needs. This includes shooting games, press conferences and special events at Yankee Stadium. Aside from photographing World Series games, All-Star activities and player milestones, Hecht often gets to travel outside the Stadium walls and into the personal lives of her subjects. 

Maddie Meyer is a recent graduate of School of Visual Communication, Ohio University - Athens and currently works as a staff photographer for Getty Images based in Boston.
results.name: Photo Brigade Panel: Women In Photography | Sports

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.

Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

results.description:
Hannah Rose Thomson will present to you Elvie, a New Type of Connected Tech For Women By Women.

Elvie's mission is to help women feel happy and confident about their whole bodies, especially at their most intimate level. Elvie is one of the first wearable tech devices designed for and used by women to help shift the conversion around women’s health by unlocking the power of the pelvic floor.

With more than one in three women experiencing physical problems in this area, the pelvic floor, its developers claim, “is one of the last uncharted territories in women’s health” even though maintaining the function of the pelvic muscles is important not just post pregnancy and childbirth but throughout a woman’s life. Elvie links to a smartphone app that guides the user through tailored workouts, which makes exercising fun and easy. Elvie is beautifully designed with new technology that coaches women on how to exercise correctly (lift, instead of bearing down) and gives accurate biofeedback via the app.

Its development was guided by a scientific advisory group including a number of well-known researchers in biofeedback and pelvic floor exercise while the team and investors behind Elvie include former Google Maps and Jawbone executives.

Elvie has won four awards (including Health Tech& You and the Red Dot Product Design award).

6:00 - 6:30 - Registration and Networking


6:30 - 7:30 - Hannah Rose Thomson presents Elvie with Q&A

7:30-8:00 - Closing Remarks
results.name: Meet Elvie - Your MOST personal trainer

results.description:
For our next #PUNTOMeetUpLabs MeetUp, join us for an amazing vocal improvisation session with Izidor Leitinger from Slovenia. 

Mr. Leitinger has more then 25 years of pedagogical experience and 5 years of artistic collaborations with Linda Wise (Pantheatre-Paris)as a composer and voice improvisation teacher, The Thorn Of Desire (NYU - New York – USA), Berlin 33 Norwegian Theatre Academy (Akademi for Scenekunst) in Fredrikstad, Norway.

Born in Slovenia, Izidor Leitinger is a musician, composer, conductor and amazing vocal coach. He did his classical trumpet studies in Graz – Austria and studied arrangement in Rotterdam – Holland. As a lead trumpet for Archies Shepp's Attica Blues Orchestra (Paris-France) he was nominated for a Grammy Award – Best Large Jazz Ensemnle - 2015 with the album I Hear The Sound. Izidor was the composer and conductor ofVolkswagnerwith Laibach and Slovenian Radio Television Symphonic Orchestra, composer and musician since 2005 for Nathalie Pubellier's dance company (Paris-France) and composer and musical director for the musical drama Pobre Inés Sentada Ahi de Alejandro Sieveking (Santiago-Chile). 

Izidor will touch upon concepts of vocal improve  as an exploration of the ever-changing dialogue between voice and the rich aspects of the soul in the art of improvisation.

Read more about Izidor HERE. 

At PUNTO, we know it's especially important to have creative resources, camaraderie within your creative community and the ability to collaborate in a space that embraces who you are! Anyone who knows PUNTO Space, knows we love the arts! All performing arts and event professionals welcome! 

*To attend this FREE MeetUp, you must RSVP and join the PUNTO Events & Performance MeetUp group. *Please note attendees may be photographed.

*THIS EVENT IS FREE. SPACE IS LIMITED to 20 spots. 

Been here before and need rehearsal space? Here's the link! 

New to PUNTO? We'd love to show off our space! Take a look at Studio A, B, C, and D while you're here! Venue ratings welcome HERE!

results.description:
Come experience the holistic healing modality of Core Energetics!

Please note that this Meetup is only open to those who have not attended before as space is limited. We will start on time and there will be no entry after 6:05pm, so please arrive early.

Core Energetics is a body-oriented psychotherapy that works with a person's emotional blocks, often held in the body. Life can be more joyful when old pain is released through energetic movement. We bring consciousness to old patterns to free ourselves and make lasting changes. 

Focusing on a holistic process involving body, emotion, mind and spirit, Core Energetics is a mode of healing that combines bodywork, psychotherapy and spiritual process. Core Energetics is applicable to many problems people face such as depression, anxiety, low self esteem, addiction, childhood and adult trauma, general dissatisfaction or a search for more meaning in their life. This method also works with stress management and chronic physical problems, including sexual dysfunction. 

A typical session consists of a combination of traditional talk therapy to bring consciousness and awareness to issues as well as various body movements to activate held energy in the body. 

Dr. John Pierrakos founded Core Energetics in 1978 and most forms of body psychotherapy and transpersonal work in the United States are informed by his work.
results.name: Introduction to Core Energetics (Body-Oriented Psychotherapy)

results.description:
Level/Prerequisite: Beginner - students and self-taught programmers. Python must be installed.

About:  (Session I) This weekly class on beginner software development tools is the first part of a regular Monday evening workshop that is also part of Byte Academy's MedTech program.  This class, however can be taken independently with no medical focus.  Session I and session II will be taught by the same teacher, Rebecca Sealfron. Today's session focuses on strings in Python.  

Session II, 7:15 pm: The medical focus proceeds in session II, which begins immediately after this class at 7:15 pm.  In this class, students will learn how to apply tools learned in Session I to the medical technology field. 

About the Teacher, Rebecca Sealfron: Ms. Sealfron is one of New York City's top female engineers and leader of New York Software Engineers and other Meetups.  She will be teaching Byte Academy's MedTech program.  

Ms. Sealfon will utilize her technical expertise along with her extensive biology and medical background to teach the course.  After graduating magna cum laude from Princeton University with an MS in ecology and evolutionary biology, Ms. Sealfon went on to receive an  MS in biology from Duke University then her MS in computational biology at Columbia.  She also is a national Scripps spelling bee winner and founded ResearchMatch .  Ms. Sealfon leads New York Software Engineers, New York City’s largest software engineering meetup and also Problem Solving Practice for Coders.
results.name: Strings in Beginner Software Development (Part 1, MedTech Mondays)

results.description:
Maintaining stable, up-to-date test environments that replicate our production system has historically been one of the most persistent problems our Engineering and Services organizations have faced, and what was initially a nuisance grew into a critical deficiency in our ability to develop, test, and debug an increasingly complex platform.

Attend this tech talk to learn how our DevOps team has built a scalable infrastructure (using Docker and other technologies) to automate the creation of scaled-down replicas of the production AppNexus platform and make them available company-wide as an on-demand service. Featuring AppNexus Engineering Team Lead Leevar Williams.

The event will also include food, drink and interactive tech demos.

RSVP via http://bit.ly/appnexustechtalks
results.name: From Small to Medium: How Test Environments Enabled Organizational Growth at App

results.description:
Join us for the Open Entrepreneur Pitching Event for Digital Media, High Tech and Healthcare Start-Ups

Every Entrepreneur Gets a Table - We Bring the Investors to You!

Now with more Investors than ever! Every Start-Up gets to pitch to our team of Investors - the audience gets to find out what's new in the Start-Up market, and what VC's are really looking for!

Startup Pitching 6:00 - 9:00 pm

After more than 10 years of helping selected Entrepreneurs raise capital - we've figured how to open it up to everyone!

This innovative event gives every Entrepreneur a shot at getting the attention of Angel Investors on the lookout for new deals. Tech & Digital Media VCs and execs get a unique opportunity to survey the marketplace at their own pace.

Startupalooza is a unique pitching contest where all start ups are ranked by a large group on Investors. The Top 4 get to do a public "pitch-off" and the winner gets up to $4500 in prizes.

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Monday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

results.description:
** Note: Please answer meetup questions as we need full names for security. You will also need to bring your ID to show building security. **

While many people are familiar with IoT applications in the consumer space, IoT applications in the B2B (Business-to-Business) space promise to have an even larger economic impact.

This session has two key parts:

The first part addresses IoT opportunities within B2B space through a panel discussion moderated by Jenny Fielding of Techstars. 

The second part features Sigfox which provides a key service for many IoT applications -- simple to integrate, energy-efficient, economical two-way transmission of small quantities of data over long distances. Sigfox is a world leading provider of dedicated connectivity for the Internet of Things. Sigfox' network complements existing high-bandwidth systems and is currently deployed or being rolled out in 18 countries with over 7 million devices in its network. For more information, see www.sigfox.com.

About Techstars IoT

Techstars IoT is partnering with PwC, GE, Bosch, SAP and Verizon to provide an unparalleled depth of experience to founders.


Techstars IoT, located in NYC at Barclays Rise, brings additional focus on the “Industrial Internet” and connecting the infrastructure of business and industry. We are active IoT investors and our accelerators’ IoT alumni include Revolv (acquired by Nest), Owlet, Astro and Sphere.

Techstars is looking for startups that are positioned to rewire the infrastructure of the future with specific emphasis on software and artificial intelligence, connected enterprise, smart cities and energy, advanced manufacturing, health and wearables, logistics and automotive, VR, AR, drones and robotics, agriculture, and the connected home.


We thank RISE and Techstars for hosting this event.

We thank Sigfox for sponsoring the food and drink for the evening.

Agenda


6:00pm  Networking, Food & Drink

6:30pm  Welcome & Intro                       Mitchell Golner, IoT Central

6:40pm  B2B IoT Panel Discussion        

    Jenny Fielding, Managing Director, TechStars, Moderator

   Haytham Elhawary, Co-founder & CEO, Kinetic

   Mike Kochanik, CRO, Flowthings.com

   Deepak Krishnamurthy, Chief Strategy Officer, SAP 


    Ajay Kulkarni, Co-founder & CEO, iobeam

7:30pm   LPWAN & How it will Change Your Business        

   Allen Proithis, President, Sigfox NA

   Francois Oudot, Sigfox

8:20pm   Member Announcements

8:25pm   Networking & Cocktail hour

9:30pm   End-of-event

Please answer the meetup questions enclosed as we must have your full name for building security. Please note that your name, email, and information provided may be shared with the meetup host and sponsors.

Everyone keeps telling me how fantastic Paulie Gee's is. Apparently it's the only vegan pizza that doesn't actually taste like vegan pizza. I'm sold!

Paulie Gee's doesn't take reservations, and they have notoriously long wait times... like... long as all hell. So I picked an odd day of the week. Even though we're arriving at 6:00,  still expect to wait over an hour. But trust me, ladies, it's worth it.  On the plus side, I have no problem bringing games for us to enjoy while on line, so the party will start way before we take a seat inside. 

Check out their menu here

Paulie Gee's is an amazing experience and as many people as possible should be able to enjoy it. So if you dare cancel so last minute that those on the wait list can't attend, I will personally come down to your house and CUT YOU! Thanks for understanding :)

See ya then!

results.description:
We will power up the Major Welch, take in the sunset & socialize briefly at Perkins Tower, then descend on the AT.

We will meet in the main parking lot. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group if we have begun. You may also begin early if you would like extra time.

This is not a beginner hike. You should have some hiking experience and be getting regular exercise. While it is only four miles, there is significant elevation gain on the Major Welch.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We will do our best to reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together. The amount of time we spend at Perkins will depend upon the weather. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. There is no sweep. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain cancels and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2 - 3 hours

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-from-the-pros-how-to-crowdfund-and-distribute-your-film-tickets-25039516869

Come meet and network with distributors, crowdsourcing professionals, and influential indie filmmakers who have figured out the secret formula! Learn how you can generate funds for your film during pre-production, and use it to influence your film's success during distribution. 


Our expert panelists (to be announced) will offer intimate and personal discussions on topics ranging from: crowdsourcing, marketing, theatrical releases, and more. After the panel discussion, there will be time for questions, drinks and networking! 

Register today so you can meet key acquisitions executives, filmmakers, and industry professionals including: 

Brian Newman: The founder of Sub-Genre, a consulting company working with major brands and nonprofits to design and implement strategic marketing campaigns using films and new media. Brian has developed overall film strategy, business development and marketing strategies for major brands including Patagonia, Yeti Coolers, Levi's (Via Imprint Projects) and Vulcan Productions among others. 

Brian is also the producer of Love & Taxes, and executive producer of Shored Up, The Invisible World and Remittance. Brian has served as CEO of the Tribeca Film Institute, president of Renew Media and executive director of IMAGE Film & Video. Brian serves on the boards of Rooftop Films, and Muse Film & Television and IndieCollect and the advisory board of Camden International Film Festival. He was born in North Carolina and has an MA in Film Studies from Emory University. 

Dani Faith Leonard: Dani Faith Leonard is a comedian and producer and co-founder of Big Vision Empty Wallet and Big Vision Creative. Big Vision Empty Wallet is a film and media incubator that creates awesome programs, encouraging independent creators to get their work made and seen. This past October, they launched Kickstart Diversity, an incentive program designed to support film and TV projects created by women, POC, and the LGBT community. In 2014, BVEW's founder launched Big Vision Creative to produce innovative multi-platform projects and offer creative and business consulting services to producer to keep them on the cutting edge and help them profit while maintaining their projects' artistic integrity. 

Through BVEW and separately, Dani has produced over 300 interactive events and live theatre productions, in addition to short films and digital content. She has lead conversations about audience building, distribution, and creative collaboration at the Sundance Film Festival, Savannah Film Festival, aTVfest, SeriesFest, and the Downtown Las Vegas Project. In[masked], she co-produced and hosted Big Vision Creatives, a live streamed show powered by ABC News. She performs stand-up and sketch comedy regularly in NYC and is working on a Slate of comedy projects for 2016, including a live show, titled Unmotivational Speaking. 

Alex Cirillo: Alex Cirillo is the Co-Founder of Big Vision Empty Wallet, a film & media incubator, and Big Vision Creative, a production company specializing in developing feature films, TV series and live events. She co-produced feature film HOW TO TELL YOU'RE A DOUCHEBAG, written and directed by Tahir Jetter, premiering at Sundance 2016. 

She's an adjunct professor at NYU teaching audience building, marketing, and distribution for filmmakers and writers, and has had the opportunity to speak on these topics at festivals nationwide, including Sundance and SXSW, where she also throws awesome parties. Over the last 6 years she's produced over 300 events internationally, ranging from award shows to experimental marketing campaigns to film screenings to celebrities' birthday parties. 

Cirillo got her start at Washington Square Arts & Films, where she produced TV pilots, commercials and digital content. While at WSF she also worked on feature films including JC Chandor's Margin Call and All is Lost, and Francine. 

Limited seats. Registration includes 1 FREE drink. For Meetup members, use promo code "Meetup" to save $5! To register, please visit: <a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/meet-the-film-distributors-a-panel-discussion-tickets-2763195793"></a>https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-from-the-pros-how-to-crowdfund-and-distribute-your-film-tickets-25039516869 ;

For questions regarding this event, please email: [masked] or[masked], ext 120

results.description:
Scaling Agile NOVA is thrilled to co-host this LIVE STREAMING event with Washington DC Scrum User Group and many other Scaling Agile meetups throughout the country.

Register here for FREE LIVE STREAM: 

https://becjjsutherland.eventbrite.com

Abstract:

The very word Agile (with a capital A) was first used in the 1994 book "Agile Competitors and Virtual Organizations." Agile, the authors argue, exacts a cost on an organization:
It requires major changes in organization, management philosophy, and operations. In our modern moment Agile and Scrum are tossed around by leaders as the newest management fad. What leadership has to recognize is that this requires not only changes in their organizations, but changes in themselves. The world of today is undergoing a rapid transition from one phase to another, and those leaders who cannot fundamentally shift how they view the world, their companies, and the way they think about work itself simply won't make it. As one evolutionist put it in 1964, "It is not the strongest species that survives, or the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change."


About the Speaker:

JJ Sutherland (@jjsutherland)

Cost: Free thanks to sponsors

Sponsor(s):

Thank you to our sponsors Berkana Enterprise Consulting  and Excella Consulting.

Don't forget to "like" either our Facebook and/or LinkedIn page for a chance to win an "Agile Related book". 


http://www.facebook.com/becteam
http://www.linkedin.com/company/becteam


BEC is HIRING: We are looking for Agile Coaches & Scrum Masters all over the US. Please submit your resume to [masked] for consideration. 


Thank you for your support of our community!!
results.name: LIVE Stream - Agile Leadership by JJ Sutherland

results.description:
***NOTE*** This group is currently full and we are not accepting any new players.


INTRODUCTION:

Until just days ago, most members of our party were blissfully unaware of the Keys of Power and their creator, the Aramago. The suddenly, they were tasked with ferrying one of these mysterious items and the courier carrying it to somewhere it would be safe.


They learned quickly that numerous were those with interest in what they possessed. Their mission was immediately fraught with danger and the party was running for its life. Then, just as quickly as it had started, it was over. The adventurers became separated from many in their group including Melrick, the wizard that had hired them to protect his journey.


They passed through an alien realm they soon became certain was the dark realm known as the Shadowfell. Their stay on the plane of shadow was short-lived, however, and they soon found themselves back in the natural world. But they were very far from home and a number of their comrades were not with them.


What will Robin, Meline, Trask, Poe, Zyle, and Malako do now? Do they try to reunite with their mates and finish their mission? If so, how will they go about finding them? These are questions they all ponder and one of their number does so along with the realization that they’ve arrived at his homeland. A homeland he had left nearly two decades prior swearing to only return when he had made his fortune.


BACKGROUND:

“In Pursuit of Power" is one of two, biweekly games I am running in the Central Jersey D&D MeetUp group under the banner of “Adventures in Azocar”. It meets on the first and third Thursdays of each month. We may also have additional meetings if there’s a fifth Monday in any given month but mostly, this will probably be kept open for make-up games.


I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game. This game will run in parallel with the “Keeper of the Keys” game with my hope being both groups can meet for a massive gaming session every now and again.
results.name: In Pursuit of Power - An Azocar Adventure

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
Visit us at Metis in New York City on Monday, May 23 at 6:30pm to see a Data Visualization with D3.js presentation by Paul Buffa, Principal Data Visualization Engineer at Capital One. 

This is an Open House for Paul's upcoming 6-week, evening Data Visualization with D3.js course, which starts on Wednesday, June 1 and will be held on Monday and Wednesday evening from 6:30 - 9:30pm through July 13. Please RSVP if you would like to learn more about the course structure and outcomes, and to see Paul present case studies for the use of D3.js. Pizza and drinks will be served.

6:30 - 7:00 Register, Mingle, Eat & Drink
7:00 - 7:30 Instructor Paul Buffa presents 
7:30 - 8:00 Chat with Paul, attendees, Metis staff - and enjoy more food & drink 

Paul Buffa 
Metis Data Visualization Instructor
Principal Data Visualization Engineer, Capital One 


Paul Buffa is a data visualization engineer at Capital One Labs, with years of experience teaching and building data visualizations in areas such as education, FinTech, marketing, politics and fitness. He has taught D3 at the Metis Data Science Bootcamp, and worked as a TA for the Data Visualization course. In addition to his work, Paul is a passionate runner who trains for marathons and ultramarathons, escaping time-to-time to train in the Colorado Rockies. You can view some of his visualizations on his public bl.ocks site, featuring datasets on running, heart rates, marketing, and other various fun topics.

Connect with us before the event! @thisismetis

results.description:
Listen up, ladies, it's time for the WSSL May .22 Rifle Shoot! Come join us at the Westside Range on May 23rd!

Have you always wanted to learn how to handle a firearm but didn't know where to start? Or do you have some (or a lot) of shooting experience but don't know where to practice in the city? Then come join us for WSSL's monthly .22 rifle shoot!  Learn safe and responsible markswoman skills with a group of fun and friendly ladies at the Westside Rifle and Pistol Range on May 23rd. 


If you want to shoot with WSSL and you've never joined us before, please read the entire event description and start your registration process with Westside ASAP! 


Feel free to bring friends! (Remind them to register in advance!) All levels are welcome (never shot, beginners, intermediate, advanced). We will have some fun shooting drills, too! This meetup is limited to women, but we do have  co-ed shoots sporadically throughout the year, so keep posted!

Register here at least five days in advance: here: http://www.westsidepistolrange.com/registration.php?referral=WSSL&glemail=rsvp@nycwssl.org 

You will receive a "transaction ID" by e-mail from the Range. Please bring this with you and a photo ID.

Price: $35 (plus tax) to the range. You can pay the range after the event: cash, check or charge. This fee includes classroom safety instruction, private instruction on the firing line, rental of a .22 rifle, one box of ammo (additional ammo is available from WSSL while supplies last; please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo) and eye/ear protection. We also ask that you please donate $5 (or whatever you feel like donating) to WSSL directly to help cover our operating costs like our website fees, locker rental at the range, etc.

Come at 6:15 PM for the club business meeting and help us plan activities -- we have some great excursions in mind -- or join us from 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM for the shooting.

FIRST TIME SHOOTERS (First time shooting with us/Westside):

When you arrive at the Range on WSSL night pick up your brown ID card at the office. (Bring your transaction ID in case your brown ID card has not been prepared.) You will sign in using the Range ID number on your brown ID card every time you attend WSSL. 
You will also need to bring other ID with you to check in on WSSL night. 

RETURNING SHOOTERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
Use the Range ID number on your brown card to sign in when you arrive on WSSL night. 


WESTSIDE RANGE MEMBERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
On WSSL night sign in using your Range membership number. Range members do not pay the $35 WSSL fee, and WSSL will provide ammo while supplies last (please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo). 

ALL SHOOTERS:

If you've registered, but find that you can't attend, please e-mail Lauren at [masked] As soon as poosible so we have an accurate headcount for the Range. 
If you have to cancel at the last minute please call the Range directly at [masked] or [masked]-9448.
results.how_to_find_us: The range is downstairs. Just walk right in and ask for WSSL! See you there!

Amrith will describe how to run PostgreSQL versions 9.3 and 9.4 on Tesora's Database as a Service Platform. The session will end with a Q&A.


We encourage everyone to attend this exciting and important project in the OpenStack ecosystem.

Thank you.

Ken and Masa

results.description:
Afristack, in partnership with Bronx Community College, offers you a free web server workshop, in particular the installation and configuration of the Nginx web server in a Linux environment.

A web server is an information technology that processes requests via HTTP, the basic network protocol used to distribute information on the World Wide Web. The term can refer either to the entire computer system, an appliance, or specifically to the software that accepts and processes the HTTP requests.


NGINX is a free, open-source, high-performance web server used by millions of websites. The following companies have deployed Nginx to power their websites: Discovery Education to deliver optimized digital experiences, WordPress.com  to help grow their web architecture, Gogo an aviation service, and NASA who uses the power of Nginx to tell the world about Mars, to name a few.


During this class you will learn:

• The basics of web servers

• How to deploy an Nginx web server in a Linux environment (Ubuntu)

• How to create a document tree using the traditional var/www convention

• Where the HTML pages "live" on web servers

• How to access the HTML pages

• How to modify the HTML pages. 


Prerequisites: None

Register @ https://nginx-web-server-afristack.eventbrite.com/

Instructor Bio:
Marcel Kouame is an IT Consultant with Trovisto Technologies. Marcel is an IT Auditor by trade and specializes in information security, compliance, and regulation within the Financial Technology, and Industrial sectors.
results.name: Web Server Workshop Presented by AfriStack & Bronx Community College

results.description:
Welcome to the Astoria Meetup Group Book Club!  Please bring your intelligence, opinions and lively conversation skills as we relax and enjoy a good book discussion together.

We will meet at "Alewife," in LIC.  Take the #7 to Vernon/Jackson.  There are 2 exits.  You want the first one as the subway enters the train station from Grand Central.  This will put you on Vernon Blvd.  Walk on Vernon, take a right on 51st Avenue.  Alewife will be on your left side.  It's a bit of a dive bar, but they have a full, fun menu, and Happy Hour until 7pm. And, their upstairs is quieter with plenty of seating. We will be upstairs, around the sofas.

This is how it goes:

6:30pm - 7pm Arrive at Alewife in LIC (from Vernon, take a right on 51st Avenue.  It's on the left side.), enjoy Happy Hour until 7pm, talk, mingle, order food.  

7pm: Book Club starts. Please try to be there by 7pm!  Everyone gets a chance to express what they thought about the book, then we go back and ask questions, and talk in depth about certain aspects of the book.  Bring your opinions, they are most welcome!

We are done somewhere between 8- 9pm.  Place closes at 10pm.

For a while I will pick the book (being the Organizer) until we get a core group.  At that point, regular core group members can pick a book.  If we are reading a particular book that you feel you are an expert on, please let me know and you can run the club for that time, if you so desire.  I welcome this!

Our next book: "Cutting Teeth" by Julia Fierro.  

One of the most anticipated debut novels of 2014, Cutting Teeth takes place one late-summer weekend as a group of thirty-something couples gather at a shabby beach house on Long Island, their young children in tow.  Very funny, interesting characters, a take on modern day parents and their "issues." I laughed my ass off!  Since we just finished a 600 page novel, I decided we should lighten up and laugh a lot this time.

Till we meet again,

Michelle
results.how_to_find_us: upstairs, around the sofas
results.name: The Astoria Meetup Group Book Club! Book: Cutting Teeth by Julia Fierro

results.description:
Note: Due to the Holiday, we will be covering this 4 hour course over 3 weeks.  On the first two weeks we will cover an hour and a half of material rather than our usual hour.  It would be a good idea to pre-watch as much of this course as possible so that you are familiar with the material before the course.

Angular 2 is one of the fastest, most popular open source web app frameworks today, and knowing how to use it is essential for developers. You'll learn how to create components and user interfaces, data-binding, retrieving data using HTTP, and more.

Whether you are new to Angular or new to Angular 2, if you want to create great web apps and stay up to date on the latest app development technologies, you're going to want to come up to speed quickly with Angular 2's components, templates, and services. This course provides the basics you need to get started building an Angular 2 application. First, you'll learn how to set up your environment, learning about components, templates, and data binding and how they work together. Next, you'll discover how to build clean components with strongly-typed code, as well as building nested components and how to use dependency injection to inject the services you build. Finally, you'll cover how to retrieve data using HTTP, navigation and routing, and you'll revisit the Angular 2 setup process. By the end of this course, you'll be up to date on all the latest Angular 2 knowledge and you'll be able to use Angular 2 to create great apps in the future.

About the Author: Deborah Kurata is an independent consultant with over 15 years of experience in designing and developing successful Microsoft .NET applications as well as mentoring software developers. Her focus is on iterative design and development, and automated unit testing. Deborah has authored several books, including the "Doing Objects" series (Addison-Wesley), "Best Kept Secrets in .NET" (Apress) and "Doing Web Development: Client-Side Techniques" (Apress). Deborah speaks at conferences such as VSLive and TechEd. For her work in support of software development and software developers, she has been recognized with the Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) award.
results.name: Angular 2: Getting Started - Week 3 of 3

results.description:
REGISTER: https://goo.gl/SZckRh

Robots have been in our minds for ages. Our imagination has been fed by science fiction, movies, cartons. But where are the robots to be seen today? You might wonder.

At Aldebaran, we’ve been making robots for the last 10 years. Programmable humanoid robots. Social robots. Robots that don’t focus on performance but rather on interacting with people. We get the feeling they are the ultimate interface. But what are they useful for? How do they work? And more importantly: why should you pay attention to them?

In this presentation, we'll invite Pepper on stage to do some demos, we’ll discuss software, hardware, sensors and emotions, we’ll share our vision about the future of robotics, and as much as we can, we’ll try to answer all the questions you have about this new species that will soon take over the world.

REGISTER: https://goo.gl/SZckRh   (do not register via Meetup.com)

Level: Intermediate

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Monday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  This group meets at the dining tables directly in front of the bowling lanes. There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

results.description:
The Hermetica are a body of mystical texts written in late antiquity, but believed during the Renaissance (when they became well known) to be much older. Their supposed author, a mythical figure named Hermes Trismegistus, was thought to be a contemporary of Moses. The Hermetic philosophy was regarded as an ancient theology, parallel to the revealed wisdom of the Bible, supporting Biblical revelation and culminating in the Platonic philosophical tradition.


The facilitator,  E. Bernard West serves the Ancient Mystical Order Rosae Crucis (AMORC) and Traditional Martinist Order (TMO) as a lifetime member. During his many years of membership he is known for his expertise in Egyptian, Greek and Roman mythology.  He is a retired Army Officer who currently serves as the TMO Provincial Master in Georgia and  Grand Councilor  for Georgia and Louisiana for AMORC EGL. He also serves various masonic affiliations including Master of a Prince Hall Affiliated Blue Lodge, Patron of an Eastern Star Chapter, a Noble of the Mystic Shrine and Grand Inspector General 33ᵒ United Supreme Council. Bernard has a Master’s of Art in Political Science and a PhD in American Studies and is a published author.

The discussions will take place Monday through Friday from 6:30 pm to 7:30 pm.
results.name: Discuss the Corpus Hermeticum

These Psychic Development and Spirit contact classes are created for people who are passionate committed and sincere about developing their Intuition, Psychic abilities and contact with Spirit.

If you have always believed you are psychic, or have seen and felt Spirit during your life, or you feel compelled to explore this part of yourself- you will love this class. Please bring an open Spirit, curiosity, enthusiasm and a belief in the possibility of many Univeses, star systems and Spirit beings and ancestors..

In this class you will Experience:

. Meditation

. Developing Your Clairvoyance, Clairsentience, , Clairaudience, Clairscent, and Clairgustance.

. Work with Spirit Guides, Gate Keepers, Spirit Teams as well as ancestors and loved ones in Spirit.

. Explore Your Dreams for their deep , ancient and powerful symbols that connect you to the Spirit universe

. Psychometry: Reading the energy imprints of objects as a way of focusing Psychic impressions and Mediumship.

. Photograph Readings: Tuning into the life experiences of people in photos beyond physical sight,  3D emotion, impressions to connect at a deeper level.

. Psychic and Mediumship Readings for other members of the class.

Developing your Intuition accelerates your success  in all areas of your life. Some people may choose to become professional Psychics and Mediums. Others will use their gifts to enhance business, career,relationships and learning about their life path and the universe we all live in

This is created for your development and for people share a passion for this work. Psychic and Mediumship Circles are most dynamic and powerful when people come on a continuous basis. 5 sequential weeks are a required starting point to see your development take off!!!!

After the 5 Week class, you can continue on, or take a break and come back..

results.description:
Lecture #4 in the Physics of Everything series, followed by a reception, where we can chat. Very inexpensive tickets, and they will sell out quickly. Tickets/ details here: http://www.nyas.org/Events/Detail.aspx?cid=43d077ca-947f-4f40-b01e-71569a0719e8

Featuring: David Chalmers (Center for Mind, Brain and Consciousness, New York University) and Max Tegmark (Massachusetts Institute of Technology)
Moderator: George Musser (Spooky Action at a Distance)
Advances in physical and information sciences, biology, and neuroscience have dramatically enhanced our knowledge of the human species. But can physical sciences solve the biggest mystery—the emergence of human consciousness? Join our panel including philosopher David Chalmers and cosmologist Max Tegmark to explore this question and its implications.
results.name: NYAS: The Rise of Human Consciousness

results.description:
Curious about the cosmos? Intrigued by evolution? Or simply wondering how scientists study the brain? Your questions have answers, and we’re bringing the brilliant minds that discovered them to you! At Pint of Science, we believe that science should be accessible to everyone, so we invite top scientists into bars to informally discuss their research. 

On May 23, 24 and 25, we will be hosting nine events across NYC as part of the global Pint of Science festival, which is the largest international science festival intended entirely for adults. Highlights for this year include evenings focused on creativity in science and exploring the flexibility of the brain, along with events hosted by our festival partners Sexology On Tap and Astronomy On Tap. 


Advance tickets and an event program are available at 


https://pintofscience.us/events/nyc

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).
results.how_to_find_us: High School on Center Blvd (aka Academy for Careers in Television and Film)  1-50 51st Ave, Long Island City, NY

results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities
• Develop new resources and capabilities
• Become clear about your life’s purpose
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.
Discover the passion and power that resides within you
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can awaken the healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please only YES RSVP if you are coming to the group

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/frenchies/events/172371032"></a>
