I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at Think Coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if more than 3 people come to the class and $15/person if 1 to 3 people come to the class.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation Intermediate. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

results.description:
The Place: Saxon + Parole, conceived by the award-winning AvroKO Hospitality Group and Executive Chef Brad Farmerie, creators of NoLIta's PUBLIC, brings a global approach to traditional grill fare, within a warm and inviting space on the Bowery. The 112-seat restaurant – named after two prize-winning, New York-bred racehorses – features rich design elements and modernist details, paying homage to the numerous horse stables that once populated Lower Manhattan. The menu explores traditional grill fare, with a focus on domestic meat and seafood, as well as seasonal and sustainable produce. Diners can expect a global twist in the seasoning, cooking methods, and ingredients – highlighted in dishes such as 28-day dry-aged NY strip steak with bone-marrow béarnaise, Heritage farms USA roasted pork rack with purple-potato salad, and roasted Atlantic cod with a tomato-caper broth, Manila clams, braised fennel, white beans and Tuscan kale

http://www.saxonandparole.com/


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks. 

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.

results.description:
Cost: Members: $5 Non-Members: $15 Non-Member Student: $7

If enough people are interested, we'll go out to dinner at a nearby diner afterward.


Link to event: http://www.nyas.org/events/...<a></a>

Over the past few decades, advances in physical and information sciences, biology, and neuroscience have dramatically enhanced our knowledge of the human species. But can physical sciences solve the biggest mystery—the emergence of human consciousness? Can consciousness be reduced to electrical and chemical processes that occur in a vast, intricately connected collection of neurons? This panel will bring together physicists, historians, cognitive scientists, and mathematicians to explore the questions: Does consciousness emerge solely from matter? Does consciousness cease completely when biological systems supporting it stop functioning? Does today's science possess tools to answer these questions definitively? And when we obtain answers to these questions, what are the implications for human existence and ethics? Join our panel including philosopher David Chalmers and cosmologist Max Tegmark to explore this question and its implications.

* Reception to follow.

Featuring:


David Chalmers, PhD
Co-Director, Center for Mind, Brain and Consciousness, New York University

Max Tegmark, PhD
Professor, Department of Physics, Massachusetts Institute of Technology

Moderator George Musser, PhD
Contributing Editor at Scientific American; author of Spooky Action at a Distance and The Complete Idiot's Guide to String Theory

Registration — Individual Lecture Prices:

Member $5
Member (Student / Postdoc / Resident / Fellow) $5
Nonmember $15
Nonmember (Student / Postdoc / Resident / Fellow) $7

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Monday night training tends to focus on techniques, and may include some light randori (free-fighting work). Please check the FAQ if you have any questions. If there isn't an answer there, shoot me an email, and I'll respond as soon as possible.

Class is free if it's your first time.  You can start training in sweats and a T-shirt or bring your own gi. We also ask that your fingernails and toenail be clipped short to avoid injury.  Please fill out this form (just name, address, contact information, and sign date it) and bring it with you.  Do not worry about paying the fee.  You'll do that if you continue training with us.  It's just that the form is also the liability waiver.

Dojo visitors from other training groups (Judo, BJJ, DZR) may pay the one time mat fee to train.

Approximate breakdown of class:
7:00: setup and change
7:15: Begin stretching and ukemi work
7:35: Begin technique work
8:45: Either randori/sparing or continue technique work
9:20: Conditioning
9:30: Class ends, put away mats, change.
results.name: Monday night technique training.

Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.

What goes better with science then a pint of beer?  Well the group Pint of Science has done just that!  They are having verious events all around NYC and this one might just be your pint of beer! 

NY Scifi & Fantasy Sponsor: 

"Seeing is Believing"  by Pint of Science

According to their event page: 

City is taken over by zombies infected with an unknown virus. The CDC announces that a cure is not possible. But that’s when (insert hot actor's name here) steps in and saves the day by (insert a crazy medical process that is very unlikely to cure anything here). We have all seen plots like this before, but how many of us know when scientific accuracy transitions to artistic creativity? 

Join us for a discussion about science in cinema, where scientists will help explain the scientific principles within some of our favorite movies. 

A panel of scientists from the fields of biology, physics, anthropology, and neuroscience will discuss these questions and more. Hosted by comedy-writer Kevin Maher. 

To see more see the event page: </a><a href="https://pintofscience.us/event/seeing-is-believing">https://pintofscience.us/event/seeing-is-believing

results.description:
Back By Popular Demand:  We are headed to Veganized Pagani!

This italian hotspot LOVED having a restaurant full of vegans and wants to have us back again...and again...and again...(They want to do this EVERY month!) 

We worked hands on with the kitchen for 3 weeks to teach the staff how to turn their menu 100% vegan and the first event got rave reviews. Now we want to invite all those who didn't have a chance to come out the first time!

The dishes are your classic pasta and meat dishes. We've done our best to make even BETTER vegan versions of each dish, including a cashew cheese plate :)

This is our chance to encourage Pagani to make this part of their everyday menu! 

• There is NO entrance fee for this event, however there is limited seating and RESERVATION is required :)

• Call[masked] to make a reservation using CODE WORD: "Veganizer"


About Veganizer:

Veganizer takes each restaurant's menu and serves it exactly as is on the evening of the event, however, it is in vegan form. Veganizer works one on one with the Executive Chef to create a mouth watering one time experience like no other. These events sell out fast because NYC is craving new and healthy cuisine outside of the traditional restaurants that we all know and love. 

About Pagani:

Pagani is an italian hot spot loved by many. The cuisine is italian inspired by Executive Chef Mark Barrett. The menu is very meat and fish centric which exotic sauces. 

About Chef Hadara:

Chef Hadara has a resume longer than most and Veganizer is thrilled to be doing their first event collaboration. She has traveled throughout the entire US as a chef and consultant. Her recipes can be found in Whole Foods, TGIF Fridays and more. Her favorite cuisine is Mexican as she has spent much time studying Latin cuisines. She is also the founder of Rawclates, the raw, organic and vegan premium chocolate company. She is a mother and entreprenuer and anyone who tries her cuisine will love every bite. 

About The Food and Drinks:

Here is the official ALLERGEN STATEMENT for all Veganizer events! 

On the night of the event, here is the menu that will be #OfficiallyVeganized. The food is A La Cart! 

Pagani is a stylish restaurant with a sheek and vintage look.

Some of Chef Hadara's Dishes

results.description:
May's book is "Body & Soul" by Frank Conroy: 

In the dim light of a basement apartment, six-year-old Claude Rawlings sits at an old white piano, picking out the sounds he has heard on the radio and shutting out the reality of his lonely world.


The setting is 1940s New York, a city that is "long gone, replaced by another city of the same name." Against a backdrop that pulses with sound and rhythm, the child prodigy develops his musical genius to pull him out of squalor and into the drawing rooms of the rich -- and a gilt-edged marriage.

But the same talent that transforms him also hurtles Claude into a lonely world of obsession and relentless ambition. From Carnegie Hall to the smoky jazz clubs of London, "Body & Soul" burns with passion and truth -- at once a riveting, compulsive read and a breathtaking glimpse into a boy's heart and an artist's soul.

Friendly reminder that there is a $2 meeting fee collected upon arrival. Suggestions for future books are always welcome; just drop a comment here or send me a message and I'll add it to the list. :) Unfortunately, I've been informed that pets are not allowed at the center after all for allergy/health code reasons (though service animals are of course permitted).

(June's book, for those who want to get a jump on things: "American Gods" by Neil Gaiman.)

results.description:
Level/Prerequisite: Prior knowledge of strings and/or an attendee of the earlier session I strings workshop

About: This hands on workshop explores how the techniques discussed in the first part (6:00 pm - 7:15 pm) are useful in Medical Technology. Attendees solve and discuss practice problems based on real-life Medical Technology challenges.

This session will be dedicated to problems in healthcare related to Methods.  It will be taught by Rebecca Sealfron, one of NYC's top female engineers, who also teaches the first part of the evening.  This session will be dedicated to problems in genomics related to strings.

About the Teacher, Rebecca Sealfron: Ms. Sealfron will be teaching Byte Academy's MedTech program.  She is one of New York City's top female engineers and leader of New York Software Engineers, New York City’s largest software engineering meetup.

Ms. Sealfon will utilize her technical expertise along with her extensive biology and medical background to teach the course.  Ms. Sealfron graduated magna cum laude from Princeton University with an MS in ecology and evolutionary biology.  She also has an MS in biology from Duke University and a MS in computational biology at Columbia.  She  is a national Scripps spelling bee winner and founded ResearchMatch.  

About Byte Academy: Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only one in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

The bar will have happy hour from 5pm to 7pm and special drink prices for the salsa crowd starting at 7:30pm, which you can read below. The dance floor will open after the class (which will end at 8:30pm) for all the people to dance with each other and have fun practicing what they learned. Don't dance? no problem, just bring your friends and meet and greet. No bouncers, no lines, no pressure, friendly people, affordable drinks.

We will start with some simple exercises, followed by a guided meditation called the Twin Hearts Meditation. After the meditation, an optional Basic Pranic Healing session is offered followed by Q&A and discussion. 

The session is by donation and a minimum of $10 is suggested. These donations will go toward paying for the room and supplies. If you truly cannot afford to contribute, join us anyway.

Please be sure to RSVP. Looking forward to seeing you all there!

No Yoga experience necessary!! Come treat and nourish yourself by scheduling a time to stop take care yourself, and simply "BE". Students will be guided to use bolsters/blankets to support the body in positions of ease and comfort, be pampered with yummy hands on adjustments, soothing music, and essential oils, all to FALL into a DEEP dreamy state relaxation. This practice aims to calm the sympathetic nervous system and activate the parasympathetic or "rest and digest" nervous system, so the body can truly heal itself! Come release mental, emotional, muscular and fasica tensions and experience all the health benefits this practice has to offer! 


Namaste, Jennifer RYT-500hr, Adv. Yin/Restorative Teacher Certifications

Limited to 12.  Do RSVP today. Kindly cancel 24hr if RSVP changes. 

By Cash or Check

results.description: If you are interested in the sport of target shooting, come join our interesting club…we have a 150 year history of getting together for good times and learning the safe use of firearms. Even for those who have never shot, held, or seen a rifle first-hand, we would be pleased to meet you at one of our practice shoots. You do not have to own a gun to attend, we welcome all who have a sincere interest in joining our unique club. Women are also welcome to join our Ladies Auxiliary …they also learn how to shoot at targets and participate in all events. Our Schuetzen gun club generally holds 2 shooting meetings every month (1st Thursday and 4th Monday). We enjoy attending an annual Club Outing, and various cultural & social events throughout the year. We are committed to teaching the safe use of firearms, and having fun shooting at targets.
results.name: Schuetzen Corps Target Shooting!

results.description:
BACK BY POPULAR DEMAND! Riverstone Yoga will host a fortnightly yoga class series for our group on 5/9, 5/23, 6/6, and 6/20 at 7:30 PM. Price for the 4-class series is $100. 


*******

Something new! We'll be trying out a runner's yoga class to complement our running routine. The focus will be on core strengthening and stretching -- both for injury prevention and to work muscles groups that are unused or underused when running. 

CLOTHING/EQUIPMENT: Wear clothes that allow for movement. Bring a water bottle and a mat if you have one; if not the studio supplies mats for a fee. 

DIRECTIONS TO THE STUDIO: The studio is located in the Hudson Harbor sales office building across from the Tarrytown Metro-North train station on the river side of the train tracks. Drive over the tracks, turn left at the top of the bridge, right on West Main, right on Orchard and right into the parking lot. The entrance is on the left. 

FEE: $100 for 4-class series.
results.name: Yoga for Runners

results.description:
This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending.  Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group.

HOW MEMBERS SUBMIT NOVEL SECTIONS:


Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam
MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.
Send to [masked]

Attach your document. RTF and DOC are preferred. Please, NO PDF's or DOCx. 


What to Expect: Nine days before the meeting you will receive an email from Meetup with links to download each story for critique from our Dropbox account. Click on the link and download the stories.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next. You can find advice about how to give a critique here.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Marcus's Novel Group

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

For experienced Circlers, the evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm.
On select evenings, Beginners are invited to join us at 6:30 pm.

See the schedule below:

May 2- Experienced Circlers
May 9 - New Circlers 6:30, Experienced Circlers 7:30
May 16 - Experienced Circlers
May 23 - Community Circling Night 7:30-10:30

Please be punctual and check-in prior to start time in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Circling Lab will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

***NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about The Connection Movement, Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010


May 2- Experienced Circlers
May 9 - New Circlers 6:30, Experienced Circlers 7:30
May 16 - Experienced Circlers
May 23 - Community Circling Night 7:30-10:30<a href="https://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/"></a>

results.description:
Join Life Fulfillment Coach and Affirmative Thought specialist Thomas Dunleavy, CPC at this weekly meetup for open hearted minds committed to living their best life now...one word at a time!

With a new affirmation set as the theme each week, Thomas helps repurpose the group's existing beliefs and thought patterns into a realistic source for inspiration and present moment empowerment! Through the use of visualization, coaching, positive psychology and of course affirmations, community members enjoy a renewed sense of optimism, excitement, strength and self love.

AFFIRMATION MONDAYS is a safe place to heal, grow, help and learn in the collective power that comes from a group.  If you're feeling lost, confused, stagnant...work it out with the group! When you're enthused, excited, passionate and pumped...share it too! The community is here to support you where you are, just as you are!

The group meets in the home sanctuary and workshop space Esoteria EVERY MONDAY at 7:30 p.m.  RSVP to [masked] or call[masked] to confirm your attendance and reserve your seat.  $12.00 love offering.

*Esoteria is the collaborative venture between Declare Coaching's Thomas Dunleavy and Bene Mudra founder James Bene. Together they are dedicated to building a community for authentic spiritual empowerment; please join them today!

www.declarecoaching.com

www.benemudra.com

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014


"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014 “ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) "Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 7:30 PM – 9:00 PM

Day: Mondays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked]

Year 2016 - Monday night schedule

March 28th

April 4th, 11th, 18th, 25th

May 2nd, 9th, 16th, 23rd

June 6th, 13th, 27th

July 11th

August 1st, 8th, 15th, 22nd, 29th

September 12th, 19th, 26th

October 3rd, 24th

November 7th, 14th, 21st, 28th

December 5th

 -------------------------------------------------------------------


I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

--------------------------------------------------------------------


Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation Energize your body Strenthen your mind Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014 


"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014 

“ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and what we have to offer so you can have the sex life and relationships that you really want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at this event are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnOn New York City!

results.description:
HackerNest Tech Socials are informal monthly meetups where the NYC tech community gets together at a local venue to hang out, make new friends, and take a break from coding.

All you have to do is show up, grab a nametag, find a beer/wine/water, and hang out - that's it, there's literally nothing formal planned. Plan on meeting new friends in the tech industry, and getting into heated debates about Emacs & Vim.

Best of all, it's free (as in beer).

Still confused? That's OK, you'll figure it out. For more info: 
HackerNest FAQ | HackerNest Twitter | HackerNest Facebook

Attendees:

That's you! Thanks for coming. Attendance is free, so all you need to do is be friendly and welcoming. We expect everyone to respect the HackerNest "No Douchebag" policy, which includes everything on the JSConf Code of Conduct, but also includes other forms of harassment like soliciting business or aggressively recruiting. Events like ours rely on everyone being great, so if you see someone being less than awesome, let us know, and they can take it elsewhere :)

Sponsors:

Sponsors make this growing movement possible, so we treasure and build deep, long-term relationships with the companies that endorse us. If you are the real deal and want to connect with the NYC tech community, let us know.

Become a HackerNestNYC Sponsor


Venue: WeWork Charging Bull

Wanna show off your office? We're always looking for big open spaces with 200+ (standing room) capacity that are easily accessible. Email us! 

Host a HackerNestNYC Event

Community Partners:

NXNE is offering members of HackerNest a special group discount for the NXNE Interactive Conference in Toronto Wednesday, June 15! Meet Nolan Bushnell, founder of Atari! Enter code hacker25 on the ticket site for special discount.

With prominent and international industry leaders, VRTO provides an intensive training segment for you to grow your knowledge. In a span of a few days, you'll equip yourself with leading knowledge on pre, principal and post 360 production as well as marketing and distribution. Get your tickets now with our exclusive Hackernest 10% discount code VRTOC2016ten.

Volunteers: 

Every city has a small team of volunteers that makes HackerNest possible. Usually, this just involves moving furniture, putting beer on ice, serving drinks, etc., and we will never let it take over your whole night. So if you can spare some time to pitch in and help out, please do!

Become a HackerNestNYC Volunteer
results.name: HackerNest NYC May Tech Social

results.description:
As of Monday, June 6th 2016:

Monday night play will be split between “A” Net and “B” Net

for the full night, 8-10pm

1.  Players will be split depending on that night’s attendance, their level of play and may be moved during the session.

2.  Placement will be based on CONSISTENT ability.

3.  There is no guarantee that if you play one night on the “A” net that you will always play on the “A” net.

4.  Walt or his substitute will determine on which net you will play and has the final say on placement.

5.  Any new players will be put onto the “B” Net until the level of play can be determined.

NOTE: This arrangement will be reconsidered every month and may be changed at the organizers discretion.

==============================================================================

Monday Night Volleyball is intended to be for more advanced, fast paced volleyball geared toward players capable of defending against a hard spike, playing within a structured offensive and defensive system. Some nights we will set up a separate net for more advanced players. This will be up to the discretion of the organizers.  No beginners, or lower skilled players please.

Please consider your safety and the safety of others when signing up. In faster systems, please realize that being out of position can result in injuries. 


A few rules :

1. Call violations on yourselves. There is no referee. 

2. A ball will be dead when entering the other court. This is for safety reasons. It doesn't matter whether the ball interferes with play or not.

results.description:
This is a meeting for people who have, or who have had at some point in the past, a good grasp of Latin grammar. If you had a few years of Latin in high school 20 years ago, chances are you'll be able to catch up without too much trouble. If you're just starting out, it might not be your cup of tea.

For next week, read lines 1-150 of Capitulum 40 of Lingua Latína II: Roma Æterna, and, if you like, reread Capitulum 2 of Familia Romana. Texts are downloadable at Lingua Latina per se Illustrata or for sale at Focus. Other resources are available at the website with videos and the flashcard website.

Macte virtúte!

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Docks Oyster Bar
40th and 3rd Ave
(633 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)

results.description:
LeTip of Hoboken

Are you looking for a way to successfully market your business? Want better, higher quality business leads? Then you have come to the right group. Survey after survey indicates that referral networking is the most cost-effective part of the marketing mix. By joining a LeTip chapter, savvy entrepreneurs are able to consistently prospect and be visible. LeTip of Hoboken has members that not only need and will use your business services, they also know others in need of your services. Each LeTip member acts as an extension to your sales and marketing team.

The LeTip Creed

LeTip is a professional networking organization of men and women dedicated to the highest standards of competence and service. Our purpose is the exchange of business tips. Members will, at all times, maintain the highest professional integrity. Each business category is represented by one member and conflicts of interest are disallowed.


A typical meeting has the following components to help you build your business: 

• You introduce your company at every meeting

• Your chapter passes qualified business Tips (Leads) throughout the meeting

• You Showboat your product two or more times a year, giving you ample opportunity to train your newfound sales force

• You have access to the expertise of other LeTip members, ongoing training and mentoring 

• Your chapter has the potential to provide a wide reach into the business community

• You become the speaker several times a year, putting the spotlight clearly on your business.


The following categories are no longer open:

Mortgage Banker
Realtor
Business Banker
Title Insurance
Real Estate Attorney
Life and Health Insurance
Accountant

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters.

A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus.

Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.

• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps.

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!

• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show

• A great profile pic

So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. results.description:
We will do cold readings of plays in progress and short pieces from 1 to 2pm and then from 2 to 3pm -- if you are an actor pressed for time that day, please let me know if 1pm or 2pm works better for you, and I will try to accommodate your needs! I want you to be able to participate with ease. 

At 3pm, we write til 4pm with a prompt. If you are only coming to write, please come by 3pm so we can start on time without interruptions. If you have paid in advance for the workshop, and you can't attend a writing session, the prompt will be sent to your email, so make sure I have your email. If you have a piece to be read, please try to send it to me via email in advance with a character breakdown to help me with casting. 

You are also free to cast your own piece -- you may not cast yourself in your piece. Give yourself the chance to honor your writing by listening to it as a writer. You may know exactly how you want it done, but that doesn't necessarily help you as a writer. Trust me on this, or ask me about it -- I am happy to discuss it with you. You can also bring in a piece and ask to have it read, and we'll read it cold. 

Please check your piece for time! Each writer gets up to ten minutes of material. This usually means ten pages if you write in accepted format with 12 point Courier font and your pages are not full of monologues. Monologues read longer than a minute a page. So time your work. 

Write Now Workshop is free for actors, but writers pay a fee that I am trying to reduce by 1) opening the workshop up to the community for free as a model for creating community and involvement and offering content to seniors who live nearby and 2) using a space that doesn't cost me a fortune (most of the fees are space fees) and 3) applying for funding as we grow and documenting the way the concept works and 4) having the workshop subsidized by patrons of the arts (already happening so that I can offer it at the current rate). 

The writers fees are currently $35 per session or $30 in advance for 9 workshops at $270 payable by cash or check or paypal to [masked]


Thank you!
Emma

results.description:
The New Jersey Economic Development Authority (NJEDA) will be visiting the EDC to discuss financing and tax credit offerings New Jersey based small-businesses and entrepreneurs can take advantage from including: 


- Technology Business Tax Certificate Transfer Program (Learn if you're eligible to sell a percentage of your net operating losses (NOLs) and research and development (R&D) tax credits to unrelated profitable corporations.

- Edison Innovation Fund (If you're an angel supported technology company with minimum trailing 12 month commercial revenues of $500,000, you may be eligible for up to $250,000 in convertible debt financing. Growth capital through the Edison Fund can be used for key hires, product rollout, product enhancement, and marketing/sales)

- Grow NJ Assistance Program (if you're creating jobs, learn how to receive tax credits ranging from $500 to $5,000 per job, per year; with bonus credits ranging from $250 to $3,000 per job, per year)

- Lending and Direct Loans (Up to $500,000 for credit worthy, small, minority-owned or women-owned businesses in New Jersey that have been in operation for at least one full year and may not have the ability to get bank financing)

- and more!  

If you're a New Jersey technology or life science small business, you won't want to miss this free seminar! 

FAQs

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

Complimentary parking will be provided on campus at the NJIT Parking Deck located at 154 Summit Street.

The EDC is also conveniently accessible by Newark Light Rail. We are the Warren St./NJIT station (three stops from Newark Penn Station). 

Photo Waiver

By registering for this event, I give permission for EDC to use any photographs or videos taken at the event on its website or in promotional materials without compensation. I understand that EDC owns all the photographs and video taken at the event.

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

Microservices are here to take over the world! In this talk we are going to be spending a few CPU cycles on sprouting containerized MongoDB services and demonstrating different setups:

- Single standalone MongoDB

- Replica Sets

- Sharding

- Ops Manager and containers

In this talk we will check how different Microservices tools interact with MongoDB containerized deployments. We will see how to use:

- Docker for basic container instantiation

- Docker Compose for Replica Set

- Docker Swarm and Kubernetes for MongoDB standalone instances scalability

- Looping in Ops Manager to manage MongoDB Deployments in containers.

Presenter: Norberto Leite, MongoDB

--------------

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE - We are using Universe for registration, so please make sure to follow the link to buy a ticket: 

http://entsale.co/johnturner


It is $15 if you buy online using the link, and $20 at the door (and it creates a backup at check-in). So please buy online, thanks!

******

We are excited to have John Turner, the Senior Vice President of Sales at TriNet, join us for this special evening to talk about sales, sales leadership, and what it takes to build a resilient sales organization.

John has not only been instrumental in the fast growth of TriNet through its public offering in 2014.  Previous to TriNet, he led sales for FalconStor, Symantec , VERITAS & Gartner, each time leading sales teams to record sales results.  In this fireside chat, we will discuss what John learned along the way to deliver high growth and repeatable sales processes, and how that can be applied to your sales organization.

Please share our community and this event with your colleagues and friends in sales.  You can http://entsale.co/johnturner">post on LinkedIn and share over Twitter as well as following the conversation on our group hashtag #B2BSales and Twitter account is @Enterprise_Sale­­. 

******

About Our Speaker

John Turner joined TriNet in April 2012 as the Senior Vice President of Sales. In this role, John is leveraging his proven leadership skills, new business development acumen, negotiation prowess and hands-on management approach to grow TriNet’s sales activities in North America while expanding the company’s sales and support teams.

Prior to TriNet, John was the Vice President of American Sales at FalconStor Software, a provider of data protection and storage virtualization solutions. Under his leadership, the FalconStor team exceeded 2011 sales goals while positioning the group for continued success during 2012. John also served as the Vice President for the Symantec Technology Sales Organization, the business-technology sales arm for Symantec’s $2B commercial business in Europe, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA). John joined Symantec during its acquisition of VERITAS, where he served as the Senior Director for Western U.S., Emerging Solutions. During his tenure at VERITAS, the business grew over 500% via organic growth and acquisitions. Prior to joining VERITAS, John was Vice President of Sales for Gartner CIO Programs, Gartner’s fastest growing business. He started with Gartner in 1998 and held several sales positions before becoming Vice President.

John received a Bachelor of Science degree from Santa Clara University in Marketing with a minor in International Relations. He was a four-year “walk on” with the Santa Clara Division One basketball team. John earned an MBA from San Jose State University and completed a certificate in Negotiation and Influence Strategies from the Stanford Business School.

******

THANKS TO OUR EXCELLENT SPONSORS

• If you need a live video platform for your events, Livestream is your best bet.

• If you wish to automagically sync mobile activity w/ Salesforce, check out Mast Mobile.

• If you are hiring sales reps and managers, you should connect with Betts Recruiting.

• If you need help with your sales contracts, reach out to Scott at McCarter & English.

• If you can use a smarter prospecting tool for your SDR's, contact Fusemachines.

• If you need to increase the performance of your sales reps, get Selleration.

• If you are running events and need better check-in software, Boomset is the best.

• If you believe referrals are key for your sales success, talk to Ricardo at Auctio.

• If you need to jump start your social media audience, we recommend GrowthChamp.

• And thanks to Work-Bench for being a great host for our community!

Being a sponsor gives you access to the largest community of B2B sales professionals in the Northeast. Reach out to Mark Birch at [masked] for more information.
results.name: Fireside Chat w/ John Turner, SVP Sales at TriNet

She loves to bake, cook, throw a good party, travel, read, collect art, do the crossword and stay on top of what's happening around the globe and in NYC.

Josh is a growth strategist in the New York City startup community. He used to produce global events for the likes of Microsoft. Now he helps marketing teams learn to think like startups.

Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

Local Sponsors

Fiverr is the world’s largest marketplace for creative and professional services, providing any digital service in one click. Whether designing a fresh website, writing colorful advertising copy or recording a catchy jingle, Fiverr Sellers deliver high-quality services in more than 150 categories.

Justworks frees entrepreneurs to focus on their business and their team. Its simple platform automates HR, payments, benefits, and government paperwork while saving companies up to 30% on healthcare. Headquartered in New York City, Justworks is funded by Bain Capital Ventures, Thrive Capital and Index Ventures. Learn more at Justworks.com.

Pivotal Labs consists of fellow practitioners and startup veterans who have a history of solving problems with early stage companies.

The Devon Group designs and delivers measurable PR and marketing programs that enable organizations to build credibility for products, services and ventures, generate qualified sales leads, and stake claims to new markets. Find out what the Devon difference can do for your company.

Our services and offerings are crafted to help your organization polish your message, reach existing audiences while finding new ones, get your messaging to resonate with customers, media, and analysts, and reach beyond your goals.

After 20+ years in business, The Devon Group knows a thing or two about finding your voice and maximizing the potential of your message. Contact our team of senior practitioners today to find out what services we have to offer your organization.

Telx, Digital Realty’s (NYSE:DLR) Colocation and Connectivity line of business, fuels infrastructure, interconnection and business progress. With industry-leading 100% uptime and 100% on-time service delivery SLAs, Telx helps companies build more agile businesses faster with reduced infrastructure complexity and broader reach to new markets. Telx colocation and connectivity products serve a broad range of industries from network dense Internet/Cloud Gateway data centers located across 13 US markets: Atlanta, Charlotte (NC), Chicago, Dallas, Los Angeles, Miami, New Jersey, New York, Phoenix, Portland, San Francisco, Santa Clara, and Seattle. With more than 50,000 network connections, Telx enables the hybrid cloud strategies of our customers, and the interconnection of more than 10 million square feet of data center space around the world.

Partners

The Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars, is a unique programme designed to take your business further. It’s fintech-focused and over-flowing with opportunities.

StrategyHack teaches marketers to be leaders in problem-solving and strategy development through a live-action, hands-on workshop with real startups.

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 170 cities and 65 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.
